Operation: a crafted packet
Consequence: a denial of service (application crash)

Description: An issue was discovered in HttpKernel in Symfony 2.7.0 through 2.7.48, 2.8.0 through 2.8.43, 3.3.0 through 3.3.17, 3.4.0 through 3.4.13, 4.0.0 through 4.0.13, and 4.1.0 through 4.1.2. When using HttpCache, the values of the X-Forwarded-Host headers are implicitly set as trusted while this should be forbidden, leading to potential host header injection.
Cause1: the values of the X-Forwarded-Host headers are implicitly set as trusted while this should be forbidden
Version: HttpKernel in Symfony 2.7.0 through 2.7.48, 2.8.0 through 2.8.43, 3.3.0 through 3.3.17, 3.4.0 through 3.4.13, 4.0.0 through 4.0.13, and 4.1.0 through 4.1.2
Consequence: host header injection

Description: An issue was discovered in Embedthis GoAhead before 4.0.1 and Appweb before 7.0.2. An HTTP POST request with a specially crafted "Host" header field may cause a NULL pointer dereference and thus cause a denial of service, as demonstrated by the lack of a trailing ']' character in an IPv6 address.
Version: Embedthis GoAhead before 4.0.1 and Appweb before 7.0.2
Operation: An HTTP POST request with a specially crafted "Host" header field
Consequence: a NULL pointer dereference and thus cause a denial of service

Description: GoPro GPMF-parser 1.2.2 has an out-of-bounds read and SEGV in GPMF_Next in GPMF_parser.c.

The HandleRFBServerMessage function in libvncclient/rfbproto.c in LibVNCServer 0.9.9 and earlier does not check certain malloc return values, which allows remote VNC servers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code by specifying a large screen size in a (1) FramebufferUpdate, (2) ResizeFrameBuffer, or (3) PalmVNCReSizeFrameBuffer message.
Cause1: does not check certain malloc return values
Operation: specifying a large screen size in a (1) FramebufferUpdate, (2) ResizeFrameBuffer, or (3) PalmVNCReSizeFrameBuffer message
Consequence: a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code

Description: Exponent CMS before 2.6.0 has improper input validation in fileController.php.

nsvdec.c in libavcodec in FFmpeg 0.7.x before 0.7.12 and 0.8.x before 0.8.11, and in Libav 0.5.x before 0.5.9, 0.6.x before 0.6.6, 0.7.x before 0.7.5, and 0.8.x before 0.8.1, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and write) via a crafted NSV file that triggers "use of uninitialized streams."
Version: FFmpeg 0.7.x before 0.7.12 and 0.8.x before 0.8.11, and in Libav 0.5.x before 0.5.9, 0.6.x before 0.6.6, 0.7.x before 0.7.5, and 0.8.x before 0.8.1
Operation: a crafted NSV file that triggers "use of uninitialized streams."
Consequence: a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and write)

Description: The igb_receive_skb function in drivers/net/igb/igb_main.c in the Intel Gigabit Ethernet (aka igb) subsystem in the Linux kernel before 2.6.34, when Single Root I/O Virtualization (SR-IOV) and promiscuous mode are enabled but no VLANs are registered, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and panic) and possibly have unspecified other impact via a VLAN tagged frame.
Location: The igb_receive_skb function in drivers/net/igb/igb_main.c in the Intel Gigabit Ethernet (aka igb) subsystem
Operation: a VLAN tagged frame
Consequence: a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and panic) and possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: iconvdata/ibm930.c in GNU C Library (aka glibc) before 2.16 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via a multibyte character value of "0xffff" to the iconv function when converting IBM930 encoded data to UTF-8.
Location: iconvdata/ibm930.c in GNU C Library (aka glibc) before 2.16
Operation: a multibyte character value of "0xffff" to the iconv function when converting IBM930 encoded data to UTF-8
Consequence: denial of service (out-of-bounds read)

Description: Multiple buffer overflows in the (1) XvQueryAdaptors and (2) XvQueryEncodings functions in X.org libXrender before 0.9.10 allow remote X servers to trigger out-of-bounds write operations via vectors involving length fields.
Location: the (1) XvQueryAdaptors and (2) XvQueryEncodings functions in X.org libXrender before 0.9.10
Operation: vectors involving length fields
Consequence: out-of-bounds write operations

Description: In the Linux kernel before 4.15, fs/ocfs2/aops.c omits use of a semaphore and consequently has a race condition for access to the extent tree during read operations in DIRECT mode, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (BUG) by modifying a certain e_cpos field.
Cause2: a race condition for access to the extent tree
Operation: modifying a certain e_cpos field
Consequence: a denial of service (BUG)

Description: In FFmpeg 4.0.1, due to a missing check for negative values of the mquant variable, the vc1_put_blocks_clamped function in libavcodec/vc1_block.c may trigger an out-of-array access while converting a crafted AVI file to MPEG4, leading to an information disclosure or a denial of service.
Cause1: a missing check for negative values of the mquant variable
Consequence: an information disclosure or a denial of service

Description: The template selection functionality in actionpack/lib/action_view/template/resolver.rb in Ruby on Rails 3.0.x before 3.0.10 and 3.1.x before 3.1.0.rc6 does not properly handle glob characters, which allows remote attackers to render arbitrary views via a crafted URL, related to a "filter skipping vulnerability."
Cause2: does not properly handle glob characters
Version: Ruby on Rails 3.0.x before 3.0.10 and 3.1.x before 3.1.0.rc6
Operation: a crafted URL
Consequence: render arbitrary views

Description: (1) apps/calendar/appinfo/remote.php and (2) apps/contacts/appinfo/remote.php in ownCloud before 4.0.7 allows remote authenticated users to enumerate the registered users via unspecified vectors.
Consequence: enumerate the registered users

Description: pfSense versions 2.4.1 and lower are vulnerable to clickjacking attacks in the CSRF error page resulting in privileged execution of arbitrary code, because the error detection occurs before an X-Frame-Options header is set. This is fixed in 2.4.2-RELEASE. OPNsense, a 2015 fork of pfSense, was not vulnerable since version 16.1.16 released on June 06, 2016. The unprotected web form was removed from the code during an internal security audit under "possibly insecure" suspicions.
Cause1: clickjacking attacks in the CSRF error page
Cause2: the error detection occurs before an X-Frame-Options header is set
Consequence: privileged execution of arbitrary code

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in user/profile.php in Moodle through 2.3.11, 2.4.x before 2.4.11, 2.5.x before 2.5.7, 2.6.x before 2.6.4, and 2.7.x before 2.7.1 allows remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the Skype ID profile field.
Version: Moodle through 2.3.11, 2.4.x before 2.4.11, 2.5.x before 2.5.7, 2.6.x before 2.6.4, and 2.7.x before 2.7.1
Operation: the Skype ID profile field
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: Multiple integer signedness errors in libavcodec/dsputil.c in FFmpeg before 2.1 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds array access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted data.
Operation: crafted data
Consequence: denial of service (out-of-bounds array access) or possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the format function in libraries/sql-parser/src/Utils/Error.php in the SQL parser in phpMyAdmin 4.5.x before 4.5.5.1 allows remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted query.
Location: the format function in libraries/sql-parser/src/Utils/Error.php in the SQL parser
Operation: a crafted query
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: The AP4_HdlrAtom class in Core/Ap4HdlrAtom.cpp in Bento4 version 1.5.0-617 uses an incorrect character data type, leading to a heap-based buffer over-read and application crash in AP4_BytesToUInt32BE in Core/Ap4Utils.h.
Cause1: uses an incorrect character data type
Consequence: a heap-based buffer over-read and application crash

Description: The (1) lc, (2) lcfirst, (3) uc, and (4) ucfirst functions in Perl 5.10.x, 5.11.x, and 5.12.x through 5.12.3, and 5.13.x through 5.13.11, do not apply the taint attribute to the return value upon processing tainted input, which might allow context-dependent attackers to bypass the taint protection mechanism via a crafted string.
Cause1: do not apply the taint attribute to the return value upon processing tainted input
Location: The (1) lc, (2) lcfirst, (3) uc, and (4) ucfirst functions
Operation: a crafted string
Consequence: bypass the taint protection mechanism

Description: OpenTrade before 2019-11-23 allows SQL injection, related to server/modules/api/v1.js and server/utils.js.

Buffer overflow in the oz_cdev_write function in drivers/staging/ozwpan/ozcdev.c in the Linux kernel before 3.12 allows local users to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted write operation.
Operation: a crafted write operation
Consequence: a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: The shared memory manager (associated with pre-authentication compression) in sshd in OpenSSH before 7.4 does not ensure that a bounds check is enforced by all compilers, which might allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging access to a sandboxed privilege-separation process, related to the m_zback and m_zlib data structures.
Cause1: does not ensure that a bounds check is enforced by all compilers
Location: The shared memory manager (associated with pre-authentication compression) in sshd
Operation: leveraging access to a sandboxed privilege-separation process
Consequence: gain privileges

Description: The XFS_IS_REALTIME_INODE macro in fs/xfs/xfs_linux.h in the Linux kernel before 4.13.2 does not verify that a filesystem has a realtime device, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and OOPS) via vectors related to setting an RHINHERIT flag on a directory.
Cause1: does not verify that a filesystem has a realtime device
Operation: vectors related to setting an RHINHERIT flag on a directory
Consequence: a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and OOPS)

Description: In BuddyPress before 5.1.2, requests to a certain REST API endpoint can result in private user data getting exposed. Authentication is not needed. This has been patched in version 5.1.2.
Operation: requests to a certain REST API endpoint
Consequence: private user data getting exposed

Description: The DefaultLinuxSpec function in oci/defaults.go in Docker Moby through 17.03.2-ce does not block /proc/scsi pathnames, which allows attackers to trigger data loss (when certain older Linux kernels are used) by leveraging Docker container access to write a "scsi remove-single-device" line to /proc/scsi/scsi, aka SCSI MICDROP.
Operation: leveraging Docker container access to write a "scsi remove-single-device" line to /proc/scsi/scsi
Consequence: data loss (when certain older Linux kernels are used)

Description: Directory traversal vulnerability in GNU patch versions which support Git-style patching before 2.7.3 allows remote attackers to write to arbitrary files with the permissions of the target user via a .. (dot dot) in a diff file name.
Version: GNU patch versions which support Git-style patching before 2.7.3
Operation: a .. (dot dot) in a diff file name
Consequence: write to arbitrary files with the permissions of the target user

Description: ORY Hydra before v1.0.0-rc.3+oryOS.9 has Reflected XSS via the oauth2/fallbacks/error error_hint parameter.
Operation: the oauth2/fallbacks/error error_hint parameter

Description: Tcpreplay before 4.3.1 has a heap-based buffer over-read in packet2tree in tree.c.

FreshDNS version 1.0.3 and earlier contains a Cross ite Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in All (authenticated) API calls in index.php / class.manager.php that can result in Editing domains and zones with victim's privileges. This attack appear to be exploitable via Victim must open a website containing attacker's javascript. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 1.0.5 and later.
Cause1: a Cross ite Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability
Location: All (authenticated) API calls in index.php / class.manager.php
Operation: Victim must open a website containing attacker's javascript
Consequence: Editing domains and zones with victim's privileges

Description: The ikev2parent_inI1outR1 function in pluto/ikev2_parent.c in libreswan before 3.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (restart) via an IKEv2 I1 notification without a KE payload.
Location: The ikev2parent_inI1outR1 function in pluto/ikev2_parent.c in libreswan before 3.7
Operation: an IKEv2 I1 notification without a KE
Consequence: a denial of service (restart)

Description: LibVNC before 0.9.12 contains multiple heap out-of-bounds write vulnerabilities in libvncclient/rfbproto.c. The fix for CVE-2018-20019 was incomplete.

In Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android, with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, untrusted pointer dereference in update_userspace_power() function in power leads to information exposure.
Version: Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android, with all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel
Consequence: information exposure

Description: The ff_h263_decode_mba function in libavcodec/ituh263dec.c in Libav before 11.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (divide-by-zero error and application crash) via a file with crafted dimensions.
Location: The ff_h263_decode_mba function in libavcodec/ituh263dec.c in Libav before 11.5
Operation: a file with crafted dimensions
Consequence: a denial of service (divide-by-zero error and application crash)

Description: In the Linux kernel before 5.2.9, there is a use-after-free bug that can be caused by a malicious USB device in the drivers/usb/misc/yurex.c driver, aka CID-fc05481b2fca.
Operation: a malicious USB device
Consequence: a use-after-free bug

Description: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in phpMyAdmin 4.1.x before 4.1.14.1 and 4.2.x before 4.2.4 allow remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted table name that is improperly handled after a (1) hide or (2) unhide action.
Operation: a crafted table name that is improperly handled after a (1) hide or (2) unhide action
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: In Tortoise ORM before versions 0.15.23 and 0.16.6, various forms of SQL injection have been found for MySQL and when filtering or doing mass-updates on char/text fields. SQLite & PostgreSQL are only affected when filtering with contains, starts_with, or ends_with filters (and their case-insensitive counterparts).
The IPv6 mobility parser in tcpdump before 4.9.2 has a buffer over-read in print-mobility.c:mobility_print().

The x25_negotiate_facilities function in net/x25/x25_facilities.c in the Linux kernel before 4.5.5 does not properly initialize a certain data structure, which allows attackers to obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory via an X.25 Call Request.
Cause1: does not properly initialize a certain data structure
Operation: an X.25 Call Request
Consequence: obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory

Description: Race condition in the scan_get_next_rmap_item function in mm/ksm.c in the Linux kernel before 2.6.39.3, when Kernel SamePage Merging (KSM) is enabled, allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted application.
Operation: a crafted application
Consequence: a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: Multiple cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerabilities in the Maestro module 7.x-1.x before 7.x-1.2 for Drupal allow remote attackers to hijack the authentication of administrators for requests that (1) change workflows or (2) insert cross-site scripting (XSS) sequences.
Version: the Maestro module 7.x-1.x before 7.x-1.2 for Drupal
Consequence: hijack the authentication of administrators for requests that (1) change workflows or (2) insert cross-site scripting (XSS) sequences

Description: An issue was discovered in Roundcube Webmail before 1.2.11, 1.3.x before 1.3.14, and 1.4.x before 1.4.7. It allows XSS via a crafted HTML e-mail message, as demonstrated by a JavaScript payload in the xmlns (aka XML namespace) attribute of a HEAD element when an SVG element exists.
Version: Roundcube Webmail before 1.2.11, 1.3.x before 1.3.14, and 1.4.x before 1.4.7
Operation: a crafted HTML e-mail message
Consequence: XSS

Description: Directory traversal vulnerability in controller/concerns/render_redirect.rb in the Wicked gem before 1.0.1 for Ruby allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a %2E%2E%2F (encoded dot dot slash) in the step.
Version: the Wicked gem before 1.0.1 for Ruby
Operation: a %2E%2E%2F (encoded dot dot slash) in the step
Consequence: read arbitrary files

Description: A buffer overflow vulnerability in lxm5700m_print_page() in devices/gdevlxm.c of Artifex Software GhostScript v9.50 allows a remote attacker to cause a denial of service via a crafted eps file. This is fixed in v9.51.
Operation: a crafted eps file
Consequence: a denial of service

Description: vcs_write in drivers/tty/vt/vc_screen.c in the Linux kernel through 5.3.13 does not prevent write access to vcsu devices, aka CID-0c9acb1af77a.
Cause1: does not prevent write access to vcsu devices

Description: Buffer overflow in the macvtap device driver in the Linux kernel before 3.4.5, when running in certain configurations, allows privileged KVM guest users to cause a denial of service (crash) via a long descriptor with a long vector length.
Operation: a long descriptor with a long vector length
Consequence: a denial of service (crash)

Description: The ccid3_hc_tx_getsockopt function in net/dccp/ccids/ccid3.c in the Linux kernel before 3.6 does not initialize a certain structure, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory via a crafted application.
Cause1: does not initialize a certain structure
Operation: a crafted application
Consequence: obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory

Description: An issue was discovered in Mongoose before 6.15. The parse_mqtt() function in mg_mqtt.c has a critical heap-based buffer overflow.
The BGP parser in tcpdump before 4.9.2 has a buffer over-read in print-bgp.c:bgp_attr_print().
A specially crafted HTML fragment can cause Sanitize gem for Ruby to allow non-whitelisted attributes to be used on a whitelisted HTML element.
Consequence: non-whitelisted attributes to be used on a whitelisted HTML element

Description: mixin-deep node module before 1.3.1 suffers from a Modification of Assumed-Immutable Data (MAID) vulnerability, which allows a malicious user to modify the prototype of "Object" via __proto__, causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.
Cause1: a Modification of Assumed-Immutable Data (MAID) vulnerability
Operation: __proto__
Consequence: the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects

Description: Buffer overflow in virt/kvm/irq_comm.c in the KVM subsystem in the Linux kernel before 3.2.24 allows local users to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors related to Message Signaled Interrupts (MSI), irq routing entries, and an incorrect check by the setup_routing_entry function before invoking the kvm_set_irq function.
Operation: vectors related to Message Signaled Interrupts (MSI), irq routing entries, and an incorrect check by the setup_routing_entry function before invoking the kvm_set_irq function
Consequence: a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code

Description: The inode double locking code in fs/ocfs2/file.c in the Linux kernel 2.6.30 before 2.6.30-rc3, 2.6.27 before 2.6.27.24, 2.6.29 before 2.6.29.4, and possibly other versions down to 2.6.19 allows local users to cause a denial of service (prevention of file creation and removal) via a series of splice system calls that trigger a deadlock between the generic_file_splice_write, splice_from_pipe, and ocfs2_file_splice_write functions.
Location: The inode double locking code in fs/ocfs2/file.c
Version: the Linux kernel 2.6.30 before 2.6.30-rc3, 2.6.27 before 2.6.27.24, 2.6.29 before 2.6.29.4, and possibly other versions down to 2.6.19
Operation: a series of splice system calls that trigger a deadlock between the generic_file_splice_write, splice_from_pipe, and ocfs2_file_splice_write functions
Consequence: a denial of service (prevention of file creation and removal)

Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the yyerror function in lib/cgraph/scan.l in Graphviz 2.34.0 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via a long line in a dot file.
Operation: a long line in a dot
Consequence: remote attackers

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in user/login.phtml in ZF-Commons ZfcUser before 1.2.2 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the redirect parameter.
Operation: the redirect parameter
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in actionscript/Jplayer.as in the Flash SWF component (jplayer.swf) in jPlayer before 2.2.23 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the (1) jQuery or (2) id parameters, a different vulnerability than CVE-2013-1942 and CVE-2013-2023, as demonstrated by using the alert function in the jQuery parameter. NOTE: these are the same parameters as CVE-2013-1942, but the fix for CVE-2013-1942 uses a blacklist for the jQuery parameter.
Location: actionscript/Jplayer.as in the Flash SWF component (jplayer.swf)
Operation: the (1) jQuery or (2) id parameters
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: The acc_ctx_cont function in the SPNEGO acceptor in lib/gssapi/spnego/spnego_mech.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) 1.5.x through 1.12.x before 1.12.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via an empty continuation token at a certain point during a SPNEGO negotiation.
Location: The acc_ctx_cont function in the SPNEGO acceptor in lib/gssapi/spnego/spnego_mech.c
Operation: an empty continuation token at a certain point during a SPNEGO negotiation
Consequence: a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash)

Description: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Chyrp before 2.1.2 and before 2.5 Beta 2 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the (1) content parameter to includes/ajax.php or (2) body parameter to includes/error.php.
Operation: the (1) content parameter to includes/ajax.php or (2) body parameter to includes/error.php
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Operation: the target parameter in an edit action
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: Buffer overflow in the __nfs4_get_acl_uncached function in fs/nfs/nfs4proc.c in the Linux kernel before 3.7.2 allows local users to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and system crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a getxattr system call for the system.nfs4_acl extended attribute of a pathname on an NFSv4 filesystem.
Operation: a getxattr system call for the system.nfs4_acl extended attribute of a pathname on an NFSv4 filesystem
Consequence: a denial of service (memory corruption and system crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: In the Linux kernel before 2.6.20, there is an off-by-one bug in net/netlabel/netlabel_cipso_v4.c where it is possible to overflow the doi_def->tags[] array.
Consequence: it is possible to overflow the doi_def->tags[] array

Description: The consume_init_expr function in wasm.c in radare2 1.3.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via a crafted Web Assembly file.
Operation: a crafted Web Assembly file
Consequence: a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash)

Description: lshell 0.9.16 allows remote authenticated users to break out of a limited shell and execute arbitrary commands.
Consequence: break out of a limited shell and execute arbitrary commands

Description: The InvertibleRWFunction::CalculateInverse function in rw.cpp in libcrypt++ 5.6.2 does not properly blind private key operations for the Rabin-Williams digital signature algorithm, which allows remote attackers to obtain private keys via a timing attack.
Cause1: does not properly blind private key operations for the Rabin-Williams digital signature algorithm
Location: The InvertibleRWFunction::CalculateInverse function in rw.cpp in libcrypt++ 5.6.2
Operation: a timing attack
Consequence: obtain private keys

Description: Mod_auth_openidc.c in the Ping Identity OpenID Connect authentication module for Apache (aka mod_auth_openidc) before 2.14 allows remote attackers to spoof page content via a malicious URL provided to the user, which triggers an invalid request.
Location: Mod_auth_openidc.c in the Ping Identity OpenID Connect authentication module
Operation: a malicious URL provided to the user
Consequence: spoof page content

Description: Multiple heap-based buffer overflows in cppcanvas/source/mtfrenderer/emfplus.cxx in Go-oo 2.x and 3.x before 3.0.1, previously named ooo-build and related to OpenOffice.org (OOo), allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted EMF+ file, a similar issue to CVE-2008-2238.
Operation: a crafted EMF+ file
Consequence: execute arbitrary code

Description: An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 4.20. drivers/phy/mscc/phy-ocelot-serdes.c has an off-by-one error with a resultant ctrl->phys out-of-bounds read.
Consequence: ctrl->phys out-of-bounds read

Description: The touchscreen driver synaptics_dsx in Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android before 2017-06-05, the size of a stack-allocated buffer can be set to a value which exceeds the size of the stack.
Cause1: the size of a stack-allocated buffer can be set to a value which exceeds the size of the stack
Version: Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android before 2017-06-05

Description: The avcodec_decode_audio4 function in libavcodec/utils.c in FFmpeg before 1.0.4 and 1.1.x before 1.1.1 allows remote attackers to trigger memory corruption via vectors related to the channel layout.
Operation: vectors related to the channel layout
Consequence: memory corruption

Description: The Zephyr parser in tcpdump before 4.9.2 has a buffer over-read in print-zephyr.c, several functions.

/usr/local/www/freeradius_view_config.php in the freeradius3 package before 0.15.7_3 for pfSense on FreeBSD allows a user with an XSS payload as password or username to execute arbitrary javascript code on a victim browser.
Location: /usr/local/www/freeradius_view_config.php in the freeradius3 package before 0.15.7_3 for pfSense
Attacker: a user with an XSS payload as password or username
Consequence: execute arbitrary javascript code on a victim browser

Description: The EbmlUnicodeString::UpdateFromUTF8 function in libEBML before 1.3.3 allows context-dependent attackers to obtain sensitive information from process heap memory via a crafted UTF-8 string, which triggers an invalid memory access.
Location: The EbmlUnicodeString::UpdateFromUTF8 function in libEBML before 1.3.3
Operation: a crafted UTF-8 string
Consequence: an invalid memory access

Description: The x86/fpu (Floating Point Unit) subsystem in the Linux kernel before 4.13.5, when a processor supports the xsave feature but not the xsaves feature, does not correctly handle attempts to set reserved bits in the xstate header via the ptrace() or rt_sigreturn() system call, allowing local users to read the FPU registers of other processes on the system, related to arch/x86/kernel/fpu/regset.c and arch/x86/kernel/fpu/signal.c.
Cause1: does not correctly handle attempts to set reserved bits in the xstate header
Operation: the ptrace() or rt_sigreturn() system call
Consequence: read the FPU registers of other processes on the system

Description: softmagic.c in file before 5.21 does not properly limit recursion, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption or crash) via unspecified vectors.
Consequence: a denial of service (CPU consumption or crash)

Description: The updateDevice function in minissdpd.c in MiniUPnP MiniSSDPd 1.4 and 1.5 allows a remote attacker to crash the process due to a Use After Free vulnerability.

Description: fs/ext4/namei.c in the Linux kernel before 3.7 allows physically proximate attackers to cause a denial of service (system crash) via a crafted no-journal filesystem, a related issue to CVE-2013-2015.

Consequence: a denial of service (system crash)

Description: Race condition in the XMPP library in Smack before 4.1.9, when the SecurityMode.required TLS setting has been set, allows man-in-the-middle attackers to bypass TLS protections and trigger use of cleartext for client authentication by stripping the "starttls" feature from a server response.

Consequence: bypass TLS protections and trigger use of cleartext for client authentication

Description: Memory leak in the cuse_channel_release function in fs/fuse/cuse.c in the Linux kernel before 4.4 allows local users to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) or possibly have unspecified other impact by opening /dev/cuse many times.
Operation: opening /dev/cuse many times
Consequence: a denial of service (memory consumption) or possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: The OLSR parser in tcpdump before 4.9.2 has a buffer over-read in print-olsr.c:olsr_print().

drivers/media/media-device.c in the Linux kernel before 3.11, as used in Android before 2016-08-05 on Nexus 5 and 7 (2013) devices, does not properly initialize certain data structures, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information via a crafted application, aka Android internal bug 28750150 and Qualcomm internal bug CR570757, a different vulnerability than CVE-2014-1739.
Cause1: does not properly initialize certain data structures
Version: the Linux kernel before 3.11, as used in Android before 2016-08-05 on Nexus 5 and 7 (2013) devices
Operation: a crafted application
Consequence: obtain sensitive information

Description: The dns_to_ldap_dn_escape function in src/ldap_convert.c in bind-dyndb-ldap 1.1.0rc1 and earlier does not properly escape distinguished names (DN) for LDAP queries, which allows remote DNS servers to cause a denial of service (named service hang) via a "$" character in a DN in a DNS query.
Cause1: does not properly escape distinguished names (DN) for LDAP queries
Location: The dns_to_ldap_dn_escape function in src/ldap_convert.c in bind-dyndb-ldap 1.1.0rc1 and earlier
Operation: a "$" character in a DN in a DNS query
Consequence: a denial of service (named service hang)

Description: The decodeTonalComponents function in the Actrac3 codec (atrac3.c) in libavcodec in FFmpeg 0.7.x before 0.7.12, and 0.8.x before 0.8.11; and in Libav 0.5.x before 0.5.9, 0.6.x before 0.6.6, 0.7.x before 0.7.5, and 0.8.x before 0.8.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop and crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a large component count in an Atrac 3 file.
Location: The decodeTonalComponents function in the Actrac3 codec (atrac3.c) in libavcodec
Version: FFmpeg 0.7.x before 0.7.12, and 0.8.x before 0.8.11; and in Libav 0.5.x before 0.5.9, 0.6.x before 0.6.6, 0.7.x before 0.7.5, and 0.8.x before 0.8.1
Operation: a large component count in an Atrac 3 file
Consequence: a denial of service (infinite loop and crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code

Description: An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.0.7. A NULL pointer dereference can occur when megasas_create_frame_pool() fails in megasas_alloc_cmds() in drivers/scsi/megaraid/megaraid_sas_base.c. This causes a Denial of Service, related to a use-after-free.
Consequence: Denial of Service

Description: In FusionPBX up to v4.5.7, the file app\conferences_active\conference_interactive.php uses an unsanitized "c" variable coming from the URL, which is reflected in HTML, leading to XSS.

Consequence: XSS

Description: The (1) udp_recvmsg and (2) udpv6_recvmsg functions in the Linux kernel before 4.0.6 provide inappropriate -EAGAIN return values, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (EPOLLET epoll application read outage) via an incorrect checksum in a UDP packet, a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-5364.
Operation: an incorrect checksum in a UDP packet
Consequence: a denial of service (EPOLLET epoll application read outage)

Description: sound/soc/msm/qdsp6v2/msm-ds2-dap-config.c in a Qualcomm QDSP6v2 driver in Android before 2016-10-05 allows attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted visualizer data length, aka Qualcomm internal bug CR 1033540.

Consequence: a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact

Location: CORE/HDD/src/wlan_hdd_hostapd.c in the Qualcomm Wi-Fi driver
Version: Android before 2016-10-05 on Nexus 5X and Android One devices
Operation: a crafted application that makes a setwpaie ioctl call

Description: drivers/vfio/pci/vfio_pci_intrs.c in the Linux kernel through 4.8.11 misuses the kzalloc function, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (integer overflow) or have unspecified other impact by leveraging access to a vfio PCI device file.

Consequence: an out-of-bounds array access

Description: The dissect_ber_constrained_bitstring function in epan/dissectors/packet-ber.c in the ASN.1 BER dissector in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.9 does not properly validate padding values, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer underflow and application crash) via a crafted packet.

Location: The dissect_ber_constrained_bitstring function in epan/dissectors/packet-ber.c in the ASN.1 BER dissector
Operation: a crafted packet
Consequence: a denial of service (buffer underflow and application crash)

Description: nfdump 1.6.17 and earlier is affected by an integer overflow in the function Process_ipfix_template_withdraw in ipfix.c that can be abused in order to crash the process remotely (denial of service).
Consequence: crash the process remotely (denial of service)

Description: The av_color_primaries_name function in libavutil/pixdesc.c in FFmpeg 3.3.3 may return a NULL pointer depending on a value contained in a file, but callers do not anticipate this, as demonstrated by the avcodec_string function in libavcodec/utils.c, leading to a NULL pointer dereference. (It is also conceivable that there is security relevance for a NULL pointer dereference in av_color_primaries_name calls within the ffprobe command-line program.)
Cause1: return a NULL pointer depending on a value contained in a file, but callers do not anticipate this

Description: In Kanboard before 1.0.47, by altering form data, an authenticated user can edit a category of a private project of another user.
Operation: altering form data
Consequence: edit a category of a private project of another user

Description: The kill_something_info function in kernel/signal.c in the Linux kernel before 4.13, when an unspecified architecture and compiler is used, might allow local users to cause a denial of service via an INT_MIN argument.
Operation: an INT_MIN argument
Consequence: a denial of service

Description: Leantime before versions 2.0.15 and 2.1-beta3 has a SQL Injection vulnerability. The impact is high. Malicious users/attackers can execute arbitrary SQL queries negatively affecting the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the site. Attackers can exfiltrate data like the users' and administrators' password hashes, modify data, or drop tables. The unescaped parameter is "searchUsers" when sending a POST request to "/tickets/showKanban" with a valid session. In the code, the parameter is named "users" in class.tickets.php. This issue is fixed in versions 2.0.15 and 2.1.0 beta 3.
Consequence: exfiltrate data like the users' and administrators' password hashes, modify data, or drop tables

Description: LibTIFF 4.0.0alpha4, 4.0.0alpha5, 4.0.0alpha6, 4.0.0beta7, 4.0.0, 4.0.1, 4.0.2, 4.0.3, 4.0.4, 4.0.4beta, 4.0.5, 4.0.6 and 4.0.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted TIFF image, related to "READ of size 512" and libtiff/tif_unix.c:340:2.
Operation: a crafted TIFF image
Consequence: a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read) or possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: A CSRF issue in phpMyAdmin 4.9.0.1 allows deletion of any server in the Setup page.

Description: The validate_as_request function in kdc_util.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC) in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.13.6 and 1.4.x before 1.14.3, when restrict_anonymous_to_tgt is enabled, uses an incorrect client data structure, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) via an S4U2Self request.

Location: The validate_as_request function in kdc_util.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC)

Operation: supplying a crafted keymap file
Consequence: crash xkbcommon keymap parsers or possibly have unspecified other impact

Consequence: heap buffer overflow

Description: MathJax version prior to version 2.7.4 contains a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the \unicode{} macro that can result in Potentially untrusted Javascript running within a web browser. This attack appear to be exploitable via The victim must view a page where untrusted content is processed using Mathjax. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 2.7.4 and later.

Consequence: Potentially untrusted Javascript running within a web browser

Description: An issue was discovered in LibVNCServer before 0.9.13. libvncserver/scale.c has a pixel_value integer overflow.

Race condition in the mac80211 subsystem in the Linux kernel before 2.6.32-rc8-next-20091201 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (system crash) via a Delete Block ACK (aka DELBA) packet that triggers a certain state change in the absence of an aggregation session.
Operation: a Delete Block ACK (aka DELBA) packet that triggers a certain state change in the absence of an aggregation session
Consequence: a denial of service (system crash)

Description: The add_doubles_metadata function in libavcodec/tiff.c in FFmpeg before 1.1 allows remote attackers to have an unspecified impact via a negative or zero count value in a TIFF image, which triggers an out-of-bounds array access.

Consequence: an out-of-bounds array access

Operation: ssid length is greater than maximum

Consequence: a use-after-free bug

Description: The LMP parser in tcpdump before 4.9.3 has a buffer over-read in print-lmp.c:lmp_print_data_link_subobjs().
An issue was discovered in Noise-Java through 2020-08-27. ChaChaPolyCipherState.encryptWithAd() allows out-of-bounds access.

Scrips_Overlay.pm in Best Practical Solutions RT before 3.8.9 does not properly restrict access to a TicketObj in a Scrip after a CurrentUser change, which allows remote authenticated users to obtain sensitive information via unspecified vectors, as demonstrated by custom-field value information, related to SQL logging.
Cause1: does not properly restrict access to a TicketObj in a Scrip after a CurrentUser change
Consequence: obtain sensitive information

Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in epan/dissectors/packet-catapult-dct2000.c in the Catapult DCT2000 dissector in Wireshark 2.x before 2.0.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet.
Location: epan/dissectors/packet-catapult-dct2000.c in the Catapult DCT2000 dissector
Operation: a crafted packet
Consequence: a denial of service (application crash)

Description: An arbitrary memory read vulnerability in Asylo versions up to 0.6.0 allows an untrusted attacker to make a call to enc_untrusted_recvfrom whose return size was not validated against the requested size. The parameter size is unchecked allowing the attacker to read memory locations outside of the intended buffer size including memory addresses within the secure enclave. We recommend upgrading past commit 6e158d558abd3c29a0208e30c97c9a8c5bd4230f
Consequence: read memory locations outside of the intended buffer size including memory addresses within the secure enclave

Description: The mpi_powm function in lib/mpi/mpi-pow.c in the Linux kernel through 4.8.11 does not ensure that memory is allocated for limb data, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (stack memory corruption and panic) via an add_key system call for an RSA key with a zero exponent.
Cause1: does not ensure that memory is allocated for limb data
Operation: an add_key system call for an RSA key with a zero exponent
Consequence: a denial of service (stack memory corruption and panic)

Description: The f2fs implementation in the Linux kernel before 4.14 mishandles reference counts associated with f2fs_wait_discard_bios calls, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (BUG), as demonstrated by fstrim.

Consequence: a denial of service (BUG)

Description: SQL injection vulnerability in dg-admin/index.php in doorGets CMS 5.2 and earlier allows remote authenticated administrators to execute arbitrary SQL commands via the _position_down_id parameter. NOTE: this can be leveraged using CSRF to allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands.

Consequence: execute arbitrary SQL commands

Description: The BPF_S_ANC_NLATTR_NEST extension implementation in the sk_run_filter function in net/core/filter.c in the Linux kernel through 3.14.3 uses the reverse order in a certain subtraction, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (over-read and system crash) via crafted BPF instructions. NOTE: the affected code was moved to the __skb_get_nlattr_nest function before the vulnerability was announced.
Cause1: uses the reverse order in a certain subtraction
Location: The BPF_S_ANC_NLATTR_NEST extension implementation in the sk_run_filter function in net/core/filter.c
Operation: crafted BPF instructions
Consequence: a denial of service (over-read and system crash)

Consequence: a denial of service (out-of-bounds heap read and crash)

Description: tcp_emu in tcp_subr.c in libslirp 4.1.0, as used in QEMU 4.2.0, mismanages memory, as demonstrated by IRC DCC commands in EMU_IRC. This can cause a heap-based buffer overflow or other out-of-bounds access which can lead to a DoS or potential execute arbitrary code.

Description: An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.0.14. There is a NULL pointer dereference caused by a malicious USB device in the drivers/usb/misc/yurex.c driver.

Consequence: a NULL pointer dereference

Description: Integer signedness error in the oz_hcd_get_desc_cnf function in drivers/staging/ozwpan/ozhcd.c in the OZWPAN driver in the Linux kernel through 4.0.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted packet.

Operation: a crafted packet
Consequence: a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code

Description: In /framework/modules/core/controllers/expHTMLEditorController.php of Exponent CMS 2.4.0, untrusted input is used to construct a table name, and in the selectObject method in mysqli class, table names are wrapped with a character that common filters do not filter, allowing for SQL Injection. Impact is Information Disclosure.
Operation: untrusted input is used to construct a table name, and in the selectObject method in mysqli class, table names are wrapped with a character that common filters do not filter
Consequence: SQL Injection. Impact is Information Disclosure

Description: An out-of-bounds read of a global buffer in the draw_line function in stb_vorbis through 2019-03-04 allows an attacker to cause a denial of service or disclose sensitive information by opening a crafted Ogg Vorbis file.

Operation: opening a crafted Ogg Vorbis file
Consequence: a denial of service or disclose sensitive information

Description: In radare 2.0.1, a memory corruption vulnerability exists in store_versioninfo_gnu_verdef() and store_versioninfo_gnu_verneed() in libr/bin/format/elf/elf.c, as demonstrated by an invalid free. This error is due to improper sh_size validation when allocating memory.
Cause2: improper sh_size validation when allocating memory

Description: python-bugzilla before 0.9.0 does not validate X.509 certificates, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof Bugzilla servers via a crafted certificate.

Description: The LLDP parser in tcpdump before 4.9.2 has a buffer over-read in print-lldp.c:lldp_mgmt_addr_tlv_print().

Consequence: crashing of containers hosting sockjs apps

Description: Revive Adserver before 3.2.3 suffers from Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF). The password recovery form in Revive Adserver is vulnerable to CSRF attacks. Both issues have been fixed.

Consequence: recovery emails to be sent to all the users at once

Description: Directory traversal vulnerability in the ZipArchive::extractTo function in ext/zip/php_zip.c in PHP before 5.4.45, 5.5.x before 5.5.29, and 5.6.x before 5.6.13 and ext/zip/ext_zip.cpp in HHVM before 3.12.1 allows remote attackers to create arbitrary empty directories via a crafted ZIP archive.

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the _renderVarInput_number function in horde/framework/Core/lib/Horde/Core/Ui/VarRenderer/Html.php in Horde Groupware before 5.2.12 and Horde Groupware Webmail Edition before 5.2.12 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectors involving numeric form fields.

Operation: vectors involving numeric form fields

Description: In Kaminari before 1.2.1, there is a vulnerability that would allow an attacker to inject arbitrary code into pages with pagination links. This has been fixed in 1.2.1.

Operation: a "#f" value in the NUM argument

Description: Scratch Addons is a WebExtension that supports both Chrome and Firefox. Scratch Addons before version 1.3.2 is vulnerable to DOM-based XSS. If the victim visited a specific website, the More Links addon of the Scratch Addons extension used incorrect regular expression which caused the HTML-escaped values to be unescaped, leading to XSS. Scratch Addons version 1.3.2 fixes the bug. The extension will be automatically updated by the browser. More Links addon can be disabled via the option of the extension.
Operation: the victim visited a specific website, the More Links addon of the Scratch Addons extension used incorrect regular expression which caused the HTML-escaped values to be unescaped
Consequence: XSS

Consequence: obtain sensitive information from uninitialized memory locations

Description: SQL Injection in framework/core/subsystems/expRouter.php in Exponent CMS v2.4.0 allows remote attackers to read database information via address/addContentToSearch/id/ and a trailing string, related to a "sef URL" issue.
Operation: address/addContentToSearch/id/ and a trailing string
Consequence: read database information

Description: While padding or shrinking a nested wmi packet in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-07-05, a buffer over-read can potentially occur.
Version: all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android)

Description: In the Linux kernel, a certain net/ipv4/tcp_output.c change, which was properly incorporated into 4.16.12, was incorrectly backported to the earlier longterm kernels, introducing a new vulnerability that was potentially more severe than the issue that was intended to be fixed by backporting. Specifically, by adding to a write queue between disconnection and re-connection, a local attacker can trigger multiple use-after-free conditions. This can result in a kernel crash, or potentially in privilege escalation. NOTE: this affects (for example) Linux distributions that use 4.9.x longterm kernels before 4.9.190 or 4.14.x longterm kernels before 4.14.139.
Cause1: a certain net/ipv4/tcp_output.c change, which was properly incorporated into 4.16.12, was incorrectly backported to the earlier longterm kernels
Operation: adding to a write queue between disconnection and re-connection, a local attacker can trigger multiple use-after-free conditions
Consequence: a kernel crash, or potentially in privilege escalation

Description: Heap-based buffer overflow in the parse_cgroup_spec function in tools/tools-common.c in the Control Group Configuration Library (aka libcgroup or libcg) before 0.37.1 allows local users to gain privileges via a crafted controller list on the command line of an application. NOTE: it is not clear whether this issue crosses privilege boundaries.
Version: the Control Group Configuration Library (aka libcgroup or libcg) before 0.37.1
Operation: a crafted controller list on the command line of an application
Consequence: gain privileges

Description: SQL injection vulnerability in Symphony CMS before 2.3.2 allows remote authenticated users to execute arbitrary SQL commands via the sort parameter to system/authors/. NOTE: this can be leveraged using CSRF to allow remote unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands.

Description: logger.c in the logger plugin in WeeChat before 1.9.1 allows a crash via strftime date/time specifiers, because a buffer is not initialized.
Operation: strftime date/time specifiers
Consequence: a crash

Description: An issue was discovered in manage_filter_edit_page.php in MantisBT 2.x through 2.15.0. A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Edit Filter page allows execution of arbitrary code (if CSP settings permit it) when displaying a filter with a crafted name (e.g., 'foobar" onclick="alert(1)').
Operation: displaying a filter with a crafted name (e.g., 'foobar" onclick="alert(1)')
Consequence: execution of arbitrary code (if CSP settings permit it)

Description: Nextcloud Server before 9.0.52 & ownCloud Server before 9.0.4 are vulnerable to a log pollution vulnerability potentially leading to a local XSS. The download log functionality in the admin screen is delivering the log in JSON format to the end-user. The file was delivered with an attachment disposition forcing the browser to download the document. However, Firefox running on Microsoft Windows would offer the user to open the data in the browser as an HTML document. Thus any injected data in the log would be executed.
Cause2: The file was delivered with an attachment disposition forcing the browser to download the document
Version: Nextcloud Server before 9.0.52 & ownCloud Server before 9.0.4
Consequence: any injected data

Description: Buffer overflow in MagickCore/enhance.c in ImageMagick before 7.0.2-7 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors related to pixel cache morphology.

Description: Leptonica before 1.80.0 allows a heap-based buffer over-read in pixFewColorsOctcubeQuantMixed in colorquant1.c.

An issue was discovered in osTicket before 1.10.7 and 1.12.x before 1.12.1. Stored XSS exists in setup/install.php. It was observed that no input sanitization was provided in the firstname and lastname fields of the application. The insertion of malicious queries in those fields leads to the execution of those queries. This can further lead to cookie stealing or other malicious actions.
Cause1: no input sanitization was provided in the firstname and lastname fields of the application
Operation: The insertion of malicious queries in those fields
Consequence: cookie stealing or other malicious actions

Description: BigTree before 4.2.22 has XSS in the Users management page via the name or company field.

Description: Artifex Ghostscript 9.22 is affected by: Obtain Information. The impact is: obtain sensitive information. Consequence: obtain sensitive information

Operation: a crafted iso9660 image with a CL entry referring to a directory entry that has a CL entry
Consequence: a denial of service (uncontrolled recursion, and system crash or reboot)

Description: The _expand_arg function in the pam_env module (modules/pam_env/pam_env.c) in Linux-PAM (aka pam) before 1.1.5 does not properly handle when environment variable expansion can overflow, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption).
Cause1: does not properly handle when environment variable expansion can overflow
Location: The _expand_arg function in the pam_env module (modules/pam_env/pam_env.c)
Consequence: a denial of service (CPU consumption)

Description: The alarm_timer_nsleep function in kernel/time/alarmtimer.c in the Linux kernel through 4.17.3 has an integer overflow via a large relative timeout because ktime_add_safe is not used.
Operation: a large relative timeout because ktime_add_safe is not used

Description: RubyGems version Ruby 2.2 series: 2.2.9 and earlier, Ruby 2.3 series: 2.3.6 and earlier, Ruby 2.4 series: 2.4.3 and earlier, Ruby 2.5 series: 2.5.0 and earlier, prior to trunk revision 62422 contains a Improper Input Validation vulnerability in ruby gems specification homepage attribute that can result in a malicious gem could set an invalid homepage URL. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 2.7.6.
Version: RubyGems version Ruby 2.2 series: 2.2.9 and earlier, Ruby 2.3 series: 2.3.6 and earlier, Ruby 2.4 series: 2.4.3 and earlier, Ruby 2.5 series: 2.5.0 and earlier, prior to trunk revision 62422
Consequence: a malicious gem could set an invalid homepage URL

Description: ctdb before 2.3 in OpenSUSE 12.3 and 13.1 does not create temporary files securely, which has unspecified impact related to "several temp file vulnerabilities" in (1) tcp/tcp_connect.c, (2) server/eventscript.c, (3) tools/ctdb_diagnostics, (4) config/gdb_backtrace, and (5) include/ctdb_private.h.
Cause1: does not create temporary files securely
Location: (1) tcp/tcp_connect.c, (2) server/eventscript.c, (3) tools/ctdb_diagnostics, (4) config/gdb_backtrace, and (5) include/ctdb_private.h
Consequence: "several temp file vulnerabilities"

Description: Multiple cross-site scripting vulnerabilities in Webmin versions prior to 1.830 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: sound/core/seq_device.c in the Linux kernel before 4.13.4 allows local users to cause a denial of service (snd_rawmidi_dev_seq_free use-after-free and system crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted USB device.
Operation: a crafted USB device
Consequence: a denial of service (snd_rawmidi_dev_seq_free use-after-free and system crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: In FreeType before 2.6.1, a buffer over-read occurs in type1/t1parse.c on function T1_Get_Private_Dict where there is no check that the new values of cur and limit are sensible before going to Again.
Cause2: is no check that the new values of cur and limit are sensible before going to Again

Description: multipart/parser.rb in Rack 1.3.x before 1.3.8 and 1.4.x before 1.4.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption and out-of-memory error) via a long string in a Multipart HTTP packet.
Operation: a long string in a Multipart HTTP packet
Consequence: a denial of service (memory consumption and out-of-memory error)

Description: SQL injection vulnerability in the GetIssues function in models/issue.go in Gogs (aka Go Git Service) 0.3.1-9 through 0.5.6.x before 0.5.6.1025 Beta allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via the label parameter to user/repos/issues.
Version: Gogs (aka Go Git Service) 0.3.1-9 through 0.5.6.x before 0.5.6.1025 Beta
Operation: the label parameter to user/repos/issues
Consequence: execute arbitrary SQL commands

Description: net/dns_resolver/dns_key.c in the Linux kernel before 2.6.38 allows remote DNS servers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and OOPS) by not providing a valid response to a DNS query, as demonstrated by an erroneous grand.centrall.org query, which triggers improper handling of error data within a DNS resolver key.
Operation: not providing a valid response to a DNS query
Consequence: a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and OOPS)

Description: Valve's Game Networking Sockets prior to version v1.2.0 improperly handles long encrypted messages in function AES_GCM_DecryptContext::Decrypt() when compiled using libsodium, leading to a Stack-Based Buffer Overflow and resulting in a memory corruption and possibly even a remote code execution.
Cause1: improperly handles long encrypted messages in function AES_GCM_DecryptContext::Decrypt() when compiled using libsodium
Version: Valve's Game Networking Sockets prior to version v1.2.0
Consequence: a Stack-Based Buffer Overflow and resulting in a memory corruption and possibly even a remote code execution

Description: The ssh_agent_channel_data function in PuTTY before 0.68 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via a large length value in an agent protocol message and leveraging the ability to connect to the Unix-domain socket representing the forwarded agent connection, which trigger a buffer overflow.
Operation: a large length value in an agent protocol message and leveraging the ability to connect to the Unix-domain socket representing the forwarded agent connection
Consequence: a buffer overflow

Description: Buffer overflow in BlueZ 5.41 and earlier allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code via the parse_line function used in some userland utilities.
Operation: the parse_line function used in some userland utilities
Consequence: execute arbitrary code

Description: shared/inc/sql/ssh.php in the SSH accounts management implementation in Domain Technologie Control (DTC) before 0.32.9 allows remote authenticated users to delete arbitrary accounts via the edssh_account parameter in a deletesshaccount Delete action.
Location: shared/inc/sql/ssh.php in the SSH accounts management implementation
Operation: the edssh_account parameter in a deletesshaccount Delete action
Consequence: delete arbitrary accounts

Description: An out-of-bounds read in the vrend_blit_need_swizzle function in vrend_renderer.c in virglrenderer through 0.8.0 allows guest OS users to cause a denial of service via VIRGL_CCMD_BLIT commands.
Operation: VIRGL_CCMD_BLIT commands
Consequence: a denial of service

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in serendipity/serendipity_admin_image_selector.php in Serendipity before 1.6.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the serendipity[textarea] parameter. NOTE: this issue might be resultant from cross-site request forgery (CSRF).
Operation: the serendipity[textarea] parameter
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: Use-after-free vulnerability in the virNetMessageFree function in rpc/virnetserverclient.c in libvirt 1.0.x before 1.0.2, 0.10.2 before 0.10.2.3, 0.9.11 before 0.9.11.9, and 0.9.6 before 0.9.6.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code by triggering certain errors during an RPC connection, which causes a message to be freed without being removed from the message queue.
Version: libvirt 1.0.x before 1.0.2, 0.10.2 before 0.10.2.3, 0.9.11 before 0.9.11.9, and 0.9.6 before 0.9.6.4
Operation: triggering certain errors during an RPC connection
Consequence: a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code

Description: Ming (aka libming) 0.4.8 has a heap buffer overflow and underflow in the decompileCAST function in util/decompile.c in libutil.a. Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service via a crafted SWF file.
Cause1: a heap buffer overflow and underflow
Location: the decompileCAST function in util/decompile.c in libutil.a
Operation: a crafted SWF file
Consequence: a denial of service

Description: In fastadmin V1.0.0.20191212_beta, when a user with administrator rights has logged in, a malicious parameter can be passed for SQL injection in URL /admin/ajax/weigh.
Cause1: a malicious parameter can be passed for SQL injection

Description: The n_tty_write function in drivers/tty/n_tty.c in the Linux kernel through 3.14.3 does not properly manage tty driver access in the "LECHO & !OPOST" case, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and system crash) or gain privileges by triggering a race condition involving read and write operations with long strings.
Cause1: does not properly manage tty driver access in the "LECHO & !OPOST" case
Operation: triggering a race condition involving read and write operations with long strings
Consequence: a denial of service (memory corruption and system crash) or gain privileges

Description: The ruby-openid gem before 2.2.2 for Ruby allows remote OpenID providers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via (1) a large XRDS document or (2) an XML Entity Expansion (XEE) attack.
Version: The ruby-openid gem before 2.2.2 for Ruby
Operation: (1) a large XRDS document or (2) an XML Entity Expansion (XEE) attack
Consequence: a denial of service (CPU consumption)

Description: An assertion-failure flaw was found in Qemu before 2.10.1, in the Network Block Device (NBD) server's initial connection negotiation, where the I/O coroutine was undefined. This could crash the qemu-nbd server if a client sent unexpected data during connection negotiation. A remote user or process could use this flaw to crash the qemu-nbd server resulting in denial of service.
Location: the Network Block Device (NBD) server's initial connection negotiation
Operation: a client sent unexpected data during connection negotiation
Consequence: crash the qemu-nbd server resulting in denial of service

Description: The (1) do_siocgstamp and (2) do_siocgstampns functions in net/socket.c in the Linux kernel before 3.5.4 use an incorrect argument order, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory or cause a denial of service (system crash) via a crafted ioctl call.
Location: The (1) do_siocgstamp and (2) do_siocgstampns functions in net/socket.c
Operation: a crafted ioctl call
Consequence: obtain sensitive information from kernel memory or cause a denial of service (system crash)

Description: An issue was discovered in EspoCRM before 5.6.9. Stored XSS was executed when a attacker sends an attachment to admin with malicious JavaScript in the filename. This JavaScript executed when an admin selects the particular file from the list of all attachments. The attacker could inject the JavaScript inside the filename and send it to users, thus helping him steal victims' cookies (hence compromising their accounts).
Operation: sends an attachment to admin with malicious JavaScript in the filename

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in lib/filelib.php in Moodle 2.0.x before 2.0.9, 2.1.x before 2.1.6, and 2.2.x before 2.2.3 allows remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via an assignment submission with zip compression, leading to text/html rendering during a "download all" action.
Operation: an assignment submission with zip compression
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: Mibew Messenger before 3.2.7 allows XSS via a crafted user name.
Operation: a crafted user name

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the image upload function in Piwigo before 2.8.6 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted image filename.
Operation: a crafted image filename
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: python-kdcproxy before 0.3.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a large POST request.
Operation: a large POST request
Consequence: a denial of service

Description: The "make distcheck" rule in GNU Automake before 1.11.6 and 1.12.x before 1.12.2 grants world-writable permissions to the extraction directory, which introduces a race condition that allows local users to execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors.
Cause1: grants world-writable permissions to the extraction directory
Consequence: execute arbitrary code

Description: A reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Dolibarr 11.0.3 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML into public/notice.php (related to transphrase and transkey).
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML into public/notice.php (related to transphrase and transkey)

Description: read_ujpg in jpgcoder.cc in Dropbox Lepton 1.2.1 allows attackers to cause a denial-of-service (application runtime crash because of an integer overflow) via a crafted file.

Consequence: a denial-of-service (application runtime crash because of an integer overflow)

Description: A local information disclosure issue was found in dracut before 045 when generating initramfs images with world-readable permissions when 'early cpio' is used, such as when including microcode updates. Local attacker can use this to obtain sensitive information from these files, such as encryption keys or credentials.
Consequence: obtain sensitive information from these files, such as encryption keys or credentials

Description: hw/net/xgmac.c in the XGMAC Ethernet controller in QEMU before 07-20-2020 has a buffer overflow. This occurs during packet transmission and affects the highbank and midway emulated machines. A guest user or process could use this flaw to crash the QEMU process on the host, resulting in a denial of service or potential privileged code execution. This was fixed in commit 5519724a13664b43e225ca05351c60b4468e4555.
Location: hw/net/xgmac.c in the XGMAC Ethernet controller
Consequence: a denial of service or potential privileged code execution

Description: common/InputStreamHelper.java in Packwood MPXJ before 8.3.5 allows directory traversal in the zip stream handler flow, leading to the writing of files to arbitrary locations.
Cause1: directory traversal in the zip stream handler flow
Consequence: the writing of files to arbitrary locations

Description: In PrestaShop contactform module (prestashop/contactform) before version 4.3.0, an attacker is able to inject JavaScript while using the contact form. The `message` field was incorrectly unescaped, possibly allowing attackers to execute arbitrary JavaScript in a victim's browser.
Consequence: inject JavaScript

Description: keepalived before 2.0.7 has a heap-based buffer overflow when parsing HTTP status codes resulting in DoS or possibly unspecified other impact, because extract_status_code in lib/html.c has no validation of the status code and instead writes an unlimited amount of data to the heap.
Cause2: extract_status_code in lib/html.c has no validation of the status code and instead writes an unlimited amount of data to the heap
Consequence: DoS or possibly unspecified other impact

Description: Revive Adserver before 5.1.0 is vulnerable to a reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability via the publicly accessible afr.php delivery script. While this issue was previously addressed in modern browsers as CVE-2020-8115, some older browsers (e.g., IE10) that do not automatically URL encode parameters were still vulnerable.
Operation: the publicly accessible afr.php delivery script

Description: sound/soc/msm/qdsp6v2/msm-ds2-dap-config.c in a Qualcomm QDSP6v2 driver in Android before 2016-10-05 allows attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via an invalid data length, aka Qualcomm internal bug CR 1027585.
Operation: an invalid data length
Consequence: a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: smtpd/lka_filter.c in OpenSMTPD before 6.8.0p1, in certain configurations, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) via a crafted pattern of client activity, because the filter state machine does not properly maintain the I/O channel between the SMTP engine and the filters layer.
Cause1: the filter state machine does not properly maintain the I/O channel between the SMTP engine and the filters layer
Operation: a crafted pattern of client activity
Consequence: a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash)

Description: The rock_continue function in fs/isofs/rock.c in the Linux kernel through 3.18.1 does not restrict the number of Rock Ridge continuation entries, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (infinite loop, and system crash or hang) via a crafted iso9660 image.
Cause1: does not restrict the number of Rock Ridge continuation entries
Operation: a crafted iso9660 image
Consequence: a denial of service (infinite loop, and system crash or hang)

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in admin/wp-security-blacklist-menu.php in the Tips and Tricks HQ All In One WP Security & Firewall (all-in-one-wp-security-and-firewall) plugin before 4.4.6 for WordPress.
Version: the Tips and Tricks HQ All In One WP Security & Firewall (all-in-one-wp-security-and-firewall) plugin before 4.4.6 for WordPress

Description: An issue was discovered in net/ipv6/ip6mr.c in the Linux kernel before 4.11. By setting a specific socket option, an attacker can control a pointer in kernel land and cause an inet_csk_listen_stop general protection fault, or potentially execute arbitrary code under certain circumstances. The issue can be triggered as root (e.g., inside a default LXC container or with the CAP_NET_ADMIN capability) or after namespace unsharing. This occurs because sk_type and protocol are not checked in the appropriate part of the ip6_mroute_* functions. NOTE: this affects Linux distributions that use 4.9.x longterm kernels before 4.9.187.
Cause1: sk_type and protocol are not checked in the appropriate part of the ip6_mroute_* functions
Operation: setting a specific socket option
Consequence: control a pointer in kernel land and cause an inet_csk_listen_stop general protection fault, or potentially execute arbitrary code under certain circumstances

Description: An issue was discovered in OpenSC through 0.19.0 and 0.20.x through 0.20.0-rc3. libopensc/card-setcos.c has an incorrect read operation during parsing of a SETCOS file attribute.

SOGo before 2.3.12 and 3.x before 3.1.1 does not restrict access to the UID and DTSTAMP attributes, which allows remote authenticated users to obtain sensitive information about appointments with the "View the Date & Time" restriction, as demonstrated by correlating UIDs and DTSTAMPs between all users.
Cause1: does not restrict access to the UID and DTSTAMP attributes
Operation: correlating UIDs and DTSTAMPs between all users
Consequence: obtain sensitive information about appointments with the "View the Date & Time" restriction

Description: fusermount in fuse 2.8.5 and earlier does not perform a chdir to / before performing a mount or umount, which allows local users to unmount arbitrary directories via unspecified vectors.
Cause1: does not perform a chdir to / before performing a mount or umount
Consequence: unmount arbitrary directories

Description: In tensorflow-lite before versions 1.15.4, 2.0.3, 2.1.2, 2.2.1 and 2.3.1, if a TFLite saved model uses the same tensor as both input and output of an operator, then, depending on the operator, we can observe a segmentation fault or just memory corruption. We have patched the issue in d58c96946b and will release patch releases for all versions between 1.15 and 2.3. We recommend users to upgrade to TensorFlow 1.15.4, 2.0.3, 2.1.2, 2.2.1, or 2.3.1.
Consequence: observe a segmentation fault or just memory corruption

Description: The virtio_gpu_set_scanout function in QEMU (aka Quick Emulator) built with Virtio GPU Device emulator support allows local guest OS users to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and process crash) via a scanout id in a VIRTIO_GPU_CMD_SET_SCANOUT command larger than num_scanouts.
Location: The virtio_gpu_set_scanout function in QEMU (aka Quick Emulator) built with Virtio GPU Device emulator support
Operation: a scanout id in a VIRTIO_GPU_CMD_SET_SCANOUT command larger than num_scanouts
Consequence: a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and process crash)

Description: In the Linux kernel before 5.3.11, there is a use-after-free bug that can be caused by a malicious USB device in the drivers/net/can/usb/mcba_usb.c driver, aka CID-4d6636498c41.

FreshDNS version 1.0.3 and prior contains a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Account data form; Zone editor that can result in Execution of attacker's JavaScript code in victim's session. This attack appear to be exploitable via The attacker stores a specially crafted string as their Full Name in their account details. The victim (e.g. the administrator of the FreshDNS instance) opens the User List in the admin interface.. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 1.0.5 and later.
Operation: The attacker stores a specially crafted string as their Full Name in their account details
Consequence: Execution of attacker's JavaScript code in victim's session

Description: The fbComposite function in fbpict.c in the Render extension in the X server in X.Org X11R7.1 allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and daemon crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted request, related to an incorrect macro definition.
Location: The fbComposite function in fbpict.c in the Render extension in the X server
Operation: a crafted request
Consequence: a denial of service (memory corruption and daemon crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code

Description: Directory traversal vulnerability in abrt-dbus in Automatic Bug Reporting Tool (ABRT) allows local users to read, write to, or change ownership of arbitrary files via unspecified vectors to the (1) NewProblem, (2) GetInfo, (3) SetElement, or (4) DeleteElement method.
Location: abrt-dbus in Automatic Bug Reporting Tool (ABRT)
Operation: unspecified vectors to the (1) NewProblem, (2) GetInfo, (3) SetElement, or (4) DeleteElement method

Description: Exponent CMS 2.3.9 suffers from a SQL injection vulnerability in "/expPaginator.php" affecting the order parameter. Impact is Information Disclosure.

Description: analyzer/protocol/dnp3/DNP3.cc in Bro before 2.3.2 does not reject certain non-zero values of a packet length, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer overflow or buffer over-read) via a crafted DNP3 packet.
Cause1: does not reject certain non-zero values of a packet length
Operation: a crafted DNP3 packet
Consequence: a denial of service (buffer overflow or buffer over-read)

Description: modules/gallery/helpers/data_rest.php in Gallery 3 before 3.0.9 allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions and obtain sensitive information (image files) via the "full" string in the size parameter.
Operation: the "full" string in the size parameter
Consequence: bypass intended access restrictions and obtain sensitive information (image files)

Description: Persistent cross-site scripting (XSS) in http/cervlet.c in Tildeslash Monit before 5.25.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to introduce arbitrary JavaScript via manipulation of an unsanitized user field of the Authorization header for HTTP Basic Authentication, which is mishandled during an _viewlog operation.

Description: The parse_notify function in util.c in sgminer before 4.2.2 and cgminer 3.3.0 through 4.0.1 allows man-in-the-middle attackers to cause a denial of service (application exit) via a crafted (1) bbversion, (2) prev_hash, (3) nbit, or (4) ntime parameter in a mining.notify action stratum message.
Operation: a crafted (1) bbversion, (2) prev_hash, (3) nbit, or (4) ntime parameter in a mining.notify action stratum message

Description: The Geo Mashup plugin before 1.10.4 for WordPress has insufficient sanitization of post editor and other user input.
Location: post editor and other user input
Version: The Geo Mashup plugin before 1.10.4 for WordPress

Description: The eHCA driver in Linux kernel 2.6 before 2.6.22, when running on PowerPC, does not properly map userspace resources, which allows local users to read portions of physical address space.
Cause1: does not properly map userspace resources
Consequence: read portions of physical address space

Description: An issue was discovered in litemall 0.9.0. Arbitrary file download is possible via ../ directory traversal in linlinjava/litemall/wx/web/WxStorageController.java in the litemall-wx-api component.
Operation: ../ directory traversal
Consequence: Arbitrary file download

Description: A flaw was found affecting the Linux kernel before version 4.17. By mmap()ing a FUSE-backed file onto a process's memory containing command line arguments (or environment strings), an attacker can cause utilities from psutils or procps (such as ps, w) or any other program which makes a read() call to the /proc/<pid>/cmdline (or /proc/<pid>/environ) files to block indefinitely (denial of service) or for some controlled time (as a synchronization primitive for other attacks).
Operation: mmap()ing a FUSE-backed file onto a process's memory containing command line arguments (or environment strings)
Consequence: utilities from psutils or procps (such as ps, w) or any other program which makes a read() call to the /proc/<pid>/cmdline (or /proc/<pid>/environ) files to block indefinitely (denial of service) or for some controlled time (as a synchronization primitive for other attacks)

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in user/register in Sockso 1.5 and earlier allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the name parameter.
Operation: the name parameter
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in PostgreSQL before 8.4.20, 9.0.x before 9.0.16, 9.1.x before 9.1.12, 9.2.x before 9.2.7, and 9.3.x before 9.3.3 allow remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors related to an incorrect MAXDATELEN constant and datetime values involving (1) intervals, (2) timestamps, or (3) timezones, a different vulnerability than CVE-2014-0065.
Version: PostgreSQL before 8.4.20, 9.0.x before 9.0.16, 9.1.x before 9.1.12, 9.2.x before 9.2.7, and 9.3.x before 9.3.3
Operation: vectors related to an incorrect MAXDATELEN constant and datetime values involving (1) intervals, (2) timestamps, or (3) timezones
Consequence: a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code

Description: The insert_module function in runtime/staprun/staprun_funcs.c in the systemtap runtime tool (staprun) in SystemTap before 1.6 does not properly validate a module when loading it, which allows local users to gain privileges via a race condition between the signature validation and the module initialization.
