Both the generic implementation (crypto/salsa20_generic.c) and x86 implementation (arch/x86/crypto/salsa20_glue.c) of Salsa20 were vulnerable.
Cause1: does not correctly handle zero-length inputs
Operation: executing a crafted sequence of system calls that use the blkcipher_walk API
Consequence: a denial of service (uninitialized-memory free and kernel crash) or have unspecified other impact

Description: The supportflow plugin before 0.7 for WordPress has XSS via a ticket excerpt.
Version: The supportflow plugin before 0.7 for WordPress
Operation: a ticket excerpt

Description: Buffer overflow in the read_server_hello function in lib/gnutls_handshake.c in GnuTLS before 3.1.25, 3.2.x before 3.2.15, and 3.3.x before 3.3.4 allows remote servers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a long session id in a ServerHello message.
Operation: a long session id in a ServerHello message
Consequence: a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly execute arbitrary code

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Horde Text Filter API in Horde Groupware and Horde Groupware Webmail Edition before 5.2.16 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via crafted data:text/html content in a form (1) action or (2) xlink attribute.
Version: Horde Groupware and Horde Groupware Webmail Edition before 5.2.16
Operation: crafted data:text/html content in a form (1) action or (2) xlink attribute
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: kernel/events/core.c in the performance subsystem in the Linux kernel before 4.0 mismanages locks during certain migrations, which allows local users to gain privileges via a crafted application, aka Android internal bug 30955111.
Operation: a crafted application
Consequence: gain privileges

Description: The get_vlc2 function in get_bits.h in Libav before 11.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and crash) via a crafted mp3 file, possibly related to startcode sequences during m4v detection.
Operation: a crafted mp3 file
Consequence: a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and crash)

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the default content option in jquery.ui.tooltip.js in the Tooltip widget in jQuery UI before 1.10.0 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the title attribute, which is not properly handled in the autocomplete combo box demo.
Location: the default content option in jquery.ui.tooltip.js in the Tooltip widget
Operation: the title attribute
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: An error within the "kodak_radc_load_raw()" function (internal/dcraw_common.cpp) related to the "buf" variable in LibRaw versions prior to 0.18.7 can be exploited to cause an out-of-bounds read memory access and subsequently cause a crash.
Consequence: an out-of-bounds read memory access and subsequently cause a crash

Description: In FusionPBX up to v4.5.7, the file app\devices\device_settings.php uses an unsanitized "id" variable coming from the URL, which is reflected on 2 occasions in HTML, leading to XSS.
Cause1: uses an unsanitized "id" variable coming from the URL
Consequence: XSS

Description: A vulnerability was found in Linux Kernel, where a Heap Overflow was found in mwifiex_set_wmm_params() function of Marvell Wifi Driver.
Location: mwifiex_set_wmm_params() function of Marvell Wifi Driver

Description: Multiple memory leaks in the x11_init_protocol function in epan/dissectors/packet-x11.c in the X11 dissector in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.14 and 1.12.x before 1.12.5 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted packet.
Location: the x11_init_protocol function in epan/dissectors/packet-x11.c in the X11 dissector
Operation: a crafted packet
Consequence: a denial of service (memory consumption)

Description: The xfs implementation in the Linux kernel before 2.6.35 does not look up inode allocation btrees before reading inode buffers, which allows remote authenticated users to read unlinked files, or read or overwrite disk blocks that are currently assigned to an active file but were previously assigned to an unlinked file, by accessing a stale NFS filehandle.
Cause1: does not look up inode allocation btrees before reading inode buffers
Operation: accessing a stale NFS filehandle
Consequence: read unlinked files, or read or overwrite disk blocks that are currently assigned to an active file but were previously assigned to an unlinked file

Description: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability in Modules.php in RosarioSIS Student Information System < 6.5.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary web script via embedding javascript or HTML tags in a GET request.
Operation: embedding javascript or HTML tags in a GET request
Consequence: execute arbitrary web script

Description: illumos osnet-incorporation bcopy() and bzero() implementations make signed instead of unsigned comparisons allowing a system crash.
Cause1: make signed instead of unsigned comparisons
Consequence: a system crash

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the strip_tags helper in actionpack/lib/action_controller/vendor/html-scanner/html/node.rb in Ruby on Rails before 2.3.13, 3.0.x before 3.0.10, and 3.1.x before 3.1.0.rc5 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a tag with an invalid name.
Location: the strip_tags helper in actionpack/lib/action_controller/vendor/html-scanner/html/node.rb in Ruby
Operation: a tag with an invalid name
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: GNU patch 2.7.2 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption and segmentation fault) via a crafted diff file.
Operation: a crafted diff file
Consequence: a denial of service (memory consumption and segmentation fault)

Description: engine/server/server.cpp in Teeworlds 0.6.x before 0.6.3 allows remote attackers to read memory and cause a denial of service (crash) via unspecified vectors.
Consequence: read memory and cause a denial of service (crash)

Description: Buffer overflow in the PATinst function in src/load_pat.cpp in libmodplug before 0.8.7 allows user-assisted remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via a long instrument name.
Operation: a long instrument name
Consequence: a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code

Description: In Libgcrypt before 1.7.7, an attacker who learns the EdDSA session key (from side-channel observation during the signing process) can easily recover the long-term secret key. 1.7.7 makes a cipher/ecc-eddsa.c change to store this session key in secure memory, to ensure that constant-time point operations are used in the MPI library.
Attacker: attacker who learns the EdDSA session key (from side-channel observation during the signing process)
Consequence: easily recover the long-term secret key

Description: The decode_init function in kmvc.c in libavcodec in FFmpeg before 0.10 and in Libav 0.5.x before 0.5.9, 0.6.x before 0.6.6, 0.7.x before 0.7.6, and 0.8.x before 0.8.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a large palette size in a KMVC encoded file.
Location: The decode_init function in kmvc.c in libavcodec
Version: FFmpeg before 0.10 and in Libav 0.5.x before 0.5.9, 0.6.x before 0.6.6, 0.7.x before 0.7.6, and 0.8.x before 0.8.1
Operation: a large palette size in a KMVC encoded file
Consequence: a denial of service (application crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code

Description: The udf_read_inode function in fs/udf/inode.c in the Linux kernel before 3.19.1 does not validate certain length values, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (incorrect data representation or integer overflow, and OOPS) via a crafted UDF filesystem.
Cause1: does not validate certain length values
Operation: a crafted UDF filesystem
Consequence: a denial of service (incorrect data representation or integer overflow, and OOPS)

Description: exprListAppendList in window.c in SQLite 3.30.1 allows attackers to trigger an invalid pointer dereference because constant integer values in ORDER BY clauses of window definitions are mishandled.
Cause1: constant integer values in ORDER BY clauses of window definitions are mishandled
Consequence: an invalid pointer dereference

Description: The Linux kernel before 3.12.4 updates certain length values before ensuring that associated data structures have been initialized, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory via a (1) recvfrom, (2) recvmmsg, or (3) recvmsg system call, related to net/ipv4/ping.c, net/ipv4/raw.c, net/ipv4/udp.c, net/ipv6/raw.c, and net/ipv6/udp.c.
Cause1: updates certain length values before ensuring that associated data structures have been initialized
Operation: a (1) recvfrom, (2) recvmmsg, or (3) recvmsg system call
Consequence: obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory

Description: parse_audio_mixer_unit in sound/usb/mixer.c in the Linux kernel through 5.2.9 mishandles a short descriptor, leading to out-of-bounds memory access.
Consequence: out-of-bounds memory access

Description: An issue was discovered in OpenEMR before 5.0.1 Patch 7. There is SQL Injection in the make_task function in /interface/forms/eye_mag/php/taskman_functions.php via /interface/forms/eye_mag/taskman.php.
Operation: /interface/forms/eye_mag/taskman.php

Description: A SQL injection vulnerability in accountancy/customer/card.php in Dolibarr 11.0.3 allows remote authenticated users to execute arbitrary SQL commands via the id parameter.
Operation: the id parameter
Consequence: execute arbitrary SQL commands

Description: Race condition in the IP implementation in the Linux kernel before 3.0 might allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (slab corruption and system crash) by sending packets to an application that sets socket options during the handling of network traffic.
Operation: sending packets to an application that sets socket options during the handling of network traffic
Consequence: a denial of service (slab corruption and system crash)

Description: A null pointer dereference vulnerability in compose_group_nonknockout_nonblend_isolated_allmask_common() in base/gxblend.c of Artifex Software GhostScript v9.50 allows a remote attacker to cause a denial of service via a crafted PDF file. This is fixed in v9.51.
Operation: a crafted PDF file
Consequence: a denial of service

Description: The XListFonts function in X.org libX11 before 1.6.4 might allow remote X servers to gain privileges via vectors involving length fields, which trigger out-of-bounds write operations.
Operation: vectors involving length fields
Consequence: out-of-bounds write operations

Description: Craft CMS before 3.3.8 has stored XSS via a name field. This field is mishandled during site deletion.
Operation: a name field

Description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ext4 filesystem. A local user can cause an out-of-bounds write in jbd2_journal_dirty_metadata(), a denial of service, and a system crash by mounting and operating on a crafted ext4 filesystem image.
Operation: mounting and operating on a crafted ext4 filesystem image
Consequence: an out-of-bounds write in jbd2_journal_dirty_metadata(), a denial of service, and a system crash

Description: Multiple buffer overflows in the command_port_read_callback function in drivers/usb/serial/whiteheat.c in the Whiteheat USB Serial Driver in the Linux kernel before 3.16.2 allow physically proximate attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption and system crash) via a crafted device that provides a large amount of (1) EHCI or (2) XHCI data associated with a bulk response.
Location: the command_port_read_callback function in drivers/usb/serial/whiteheat.c in the Whiteheat USB Serial Driver
Operation: a crafted device that provides a large amount of (1) EHCI or (2) XHCI data associated with a bulk response
Consequence: execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption and system crash)

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in admin/copy_field.php in MantisBT before 1.2.18 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the dest_id field.
Operation: the dest_id field
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: Cross-site request forgery in the REST API in IPython 2 and 3.

Tor 0.3.x before 0.3.0.9 has a guard-selection algorithm that only considers the exit relay (not the exit relay's family), which might allow remote attackers to defeat intended anonymity properties by leveraging the existence of large families.
Cause1: has a guard-selection algorithm that only considers the exit relay (not the exit relay's family)
Operation: leveraging the existence of large families
Consequence: defeat intended anonymity properties

Description: The DECnet parser in tcpdump before 4.9.2 has a buffer over-read in print-decnet.c:decnet_print().

The parse_string function in cjson.c in the cJSON library mishandles UTF8/16 strings, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code via a non-hex character in a JSON string, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.
Operation: a non-hex character in a JSON string
Consequence: a heap-based buffer overflow

Description: The cpansign verify functionality in the Module::Signature module before 0.72 for Perl allows attackers to bypass the signature check and execute arbitrary code via a SIGNATURE file with a "special unknown cipher" that references an untrusted module in Digest/.
Version: the Module::Signature module before 0.72 for Perl
Operation: a SIGNATURE file with a "special unknown cipher" that references an untrusted module in Digest/
Consequence: bypass the signature check and execute arbitrary code

Description: A stored-self XSS exists in web/skins/classic/views/zones.php of ZoneMinder through 1.32.3, allowing an attacker to execute HTML or JavaScript code in a vulnerable field via a crafted Zone NAME to the index.php?view=zones&action=zoneImage&mid=1 URI.
Operation: a crafted Zone NAME to the index.php?view=zones&action=zoneImage&mid=1 URI
Consequence: execute HTML or JavaScript code in a vulnerable field

Description: The Bluetooth protocol stack in the Linux kernel before 3.6 does not properly initialize certain structures, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory via a crafted application that targets the (1) L2CAP or (2) HCI implementation.
Cause1: does not properly initialize certain structures
Operation: a crafted application that targets the (1) L2CAP or (2) HCI implementation
Consequence: obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory

Description: ImageMagick 7.0.8-50 Q16 has a stack-based buffer overflow at coders/pnm.c in WritePNMImage because of a misplaced assignment.

Open Ticket Request System (OTRS) 4.0.x before 4.0.28, 5.0.x before 5.0.26, and 6.0.x before 6.0.3, when cookie support is disabled, might allow remote attackers to hijack web sessions and consequently gain privileges via a crafted email.
Version: Open Ticket Request System (OTRS) 4.0.x before 4.0.28, 5.0.x before 5.0.26, and 6.0.x before 6.0.3
Operation: a crafted email
Consequence: hijack web sessions and consequently gain privileges

Description: The modern style negotiation in Network Block Device (nbd-server) 2.9.22 through 3.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (root process termination) by (1) closing the connection during negotiation or (2) specifying a name for a non-existent export.
Operation: (1) closing the connection during negotiation or (2) specifying a name for a non-existent export
Consequence: a denial of service (root process termination)

Description: import.php in phpMyAdmin 4.x before 4.0.4.1 does not properly restrict the ability of input data to specify a file format, which allows remote authenticated users to modify the GLOBALS superglobal array, and consequently change the configuration, via a crafted request.
Cause1: does not properly restrict the ability of input data to specify a file format
Operation: a crafted request
Consequence: modify the GLOBALS superglobal array, and consequently change the configuration

Description: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in phpMyAdmin 4.0.x before 4.0.10.4, 4.1.x before 4.1.14.5, and 4.2.x before 4.2.9.1 allow remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted ENUM value that is improperly handled during rendering of the (1) table search or (2) table structure page, related to libraries/TableSearch.class.php and libraries/Util.class.php.
Operation: a crafted ENUM value that is improperly handled during rendering of the (1) table search or (2) table structure page, related to libraries/TableSearch.class.php and libraries/Util.class.php
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: Multiple directory traversal vulnerabilities in the relational schema implementation in phpMyAdmin 3.4.x before 3.4.3.2 allow remote authenticated users to include and execute arbitrary local files via directory traversal sequences in an export type field, related to (1) libraries/schema/User_Schema.class.php and (2) schema_export.php.
Operation: directory traversal sequences in an export type field
Consequence: include and execute arbitrary local files

Description: An issue was discovered in drivers/scsi/qedi/qedi_dbg.c in the Linux kernel before 5.1.12. In the qedi_dbg_* family of functions, there is an out-of-bounds read.
Perl before 5.26.3 has a buffer over-read via a crafted regular expression that triggers disclosure of sensitive information from process memory.
Operation: a crafted regular expression
Consequence: disclosure of sensitive information from process memory

Description: Oniguruma through 6.9.3, as used in PHP 7.3.x and other products, has a heap-based buffer over-read in str_lower_case_match in regexec.c.
Version: Oniguruma through 6.9.3, as used in PHP 7.3.x and other products

Description: Android before 2.3 does not properly restrict access to the system property space, which allows local applications to bypass the application sandbox and gain privileges, as demonstrated by psneuter and KillingInTheNameOf, related to the use of Android shared memory (ashmem) and ASHMEM_SET_PROT_MASK.
Cause1: does not properly restrict access to the system property space
Consequence: bypass the application sandbox and gain privileges

Description: Race condition in Oracle MySQL before 5.5.52, 5.6.x before 5.6.33, 5.7.x before 5.7.15, and 8.x before 8.0.1; MariaDB before 5.5.52, 10.0.x before 10.0.28, and 10.1.x before 10.1.18; Percona Server before 5.5.51-38.2, 5.6.x before 5.6.32-78-1, and 5.7.x before 5.7.14-8; and Percona XtraDB Cluster before 5.5.41-37.0, 5.6.x before 5.6.32-25.17, and 5.7.x before 5.7.14-26.17 allows local users with certain permissions to gain privileges by leveraging use of my_copystat by REPAIR TABLE to repair a MyISAM table.
Version: Oracle MySQL before 5.5.52, 5.6.x before 5.6.33, 5.7.x before 5.7.15, and 8.x before 8.0.1; MariaDB before 5.5.52, 10.0.x before 10.0.28, and 10.1.x before 10.1.18; Percona Server before 5.5.51-38.2, 5.6.x before 5.6.32-78-1, and 5.7.x before 5.7.14-8; and Percona XtraDB Cluster before 5.5.41-37.0, 5.6.x before 5.6.32-25.17, and 5.7.x before 5.7.14-26.17
Operation: leveraging use of my_copystat by REPAIR TABLE to repair a MyISAM table
Consequence: gain privileges

Description: The IKEv1 parser in tcpdump before 4.9.3 has a buffer over-read in print-isakmp.c:ikev1_n_print().

The (1) red_channel_pipes_add_type and (2) red_channel_pipes_add_empty_msg functions in server/red_channel.c in SPICE before 0.12.4 do not properly perform ring loops, which might allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (reachable assertion and server exit) by triggering a network error.
Cause1: do not properly perform ring loops
Location: The (1) red_channel_pipes_add_type and (2) red_channel_pipes_add_empty_msg functions in server/red_channel.c
Operation: triggering a network error
Consequence: a denial of service (reachable assertion and server exit)

Description: ServiceStack ServiceStack Framework 4.5.14 is affected by: Cross Site Scripting (XSS). The impact is: JavaScrpit is reflected in the server response, hence executed by the browser. The component is: the query used in the GET request is prone. The attack vector is: Since there is no server-side validation and If Browser encoding is bypassed, the victim is affected when opening a crafted URL. The fixed version is: 5.2.0.
Location: the query used in the GET request is prone
Operation: opening a crafted URL
Consequence: JavaScrpit is reflected in the server response, hence executed by the browser

Description: Use-after-free vulnerability in drivers/net/ppp/ppp_generic.c in the Linux kernel before 4.5.2 allows local users to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and system crash, or spinlock) or possibly have unspecified other impact by removing a network namespace, related to the ppp_register_net_channel and ppp_unregister_channel functions.
Operation: removing a network namespace
Consequence: a denial of service (memory corruption and system crash, or spinlock) or possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: epan/dissectors/packet-catapult-dct2000.c in the Catapult DCT2000 dissector in Wireshark 2.x before 2.0.6 does not restrict the number of channels, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer over-read and application crash) via a crafted packet.
Cause1: does not restrict the number of channels
Location: epan/dissectors/packet-catapult-dct2000.c in the Catapult DCT2000 dissector
Operation: a crafted packet
Consequence: a denial of service (buffer over-read and application crash)

Description: The generic decoder in ImageMagick allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds access) via a crafted file.
Operation: a crafted file
Consequence: a denial of service (out-of-bounds access)

Description: In spectral_create_samp_msg() in Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android before 2017-10-11, some values from firmware are not properly validated potentially leading to a buffer overflow.
Cause1: some values from firmware are not properly validated potentially
Version: Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, and QRD Android before 2017-10-11
Consequence: a buffer overflow

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in plugins/main/content/js/ajenti.coffee in Eugene Pankov Ajenti 1.2.13 allows remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the command field in the Cron functionality.
Operation: the command field in the Cron functionality
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: folly::secureRandom will re-use a buffer between parent and child processes when fork() is called. That will result in multiple forked children producing repeat (or similar) results. This affects HHVM 3.26 prior to 3.26.3 and the folly library between v2017.12.11.00 and v2018.08.09.00.
Cause1: re-use a buffer between parent and child processes
Version: HHVM 3.26 prior to 3.26.3 and the folly library between v2017.12.11.00 and v2018.08.09.00
Consequence: multiple forked children producing repeat (or similar) results

Description: The bmp_read_info_header function in bin/jp2/convertbmp.c in OpenJPEG 2.2.0 does not reject headers with a zero biBitCount, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory allocation failure) in the opj_image_create function in lib/openjp2/image.c, related to the opj_aligned_alloc_n function in opj_malloc.c.
Cause1: does not reject headers with a zero biBitCount
Consequence: a denial of service (memory allocation failure)

Description: The econet_sendmsg function in net/econet/af_econet.c in the Linux kernel before 2.6.39 on the x86_64 platform allows remote attackers to obtain potentially sensitive information from kernel stack memory by reading uninitialized data in the ah field of an Acorn Universal Networking (AUN) packet.
Version: the Linux kernel before 2.6.39 on the x86_64 platform
Operation: reading uninitialized data in the ah field of an Acorn Universal Networking (AUN) packet
Consequence: obtain potentially sensitive information from kernel stack memory

Description: Two errors in the "asn1_find_node()" function (lib/parser_aux.c) within GnuTLS libtasn1 version 4.10 can be exploited to cause a stacked-based buffer overflow by tricking a user into processing a specially crafted assignments file via the e.g. asn1Coding utility.
Operation: tricking a user into processing a specially crafted assignments file via the e.g. asn1Coding utility
Consequence: a stacked-based buffer overflow

Description: sound/soc/msm/qdsp6v2/audio_calibration.c in the Qualcomm sound driver in Android before 2016-10-05 on Nexus 5X, Nexus 6P, and Android One devices allows attackers to obtain sensitive information via a crafted application, aka Android internal bug 29323142 and Qualcomm internal bug CR 1038127.
Location: sound/soc/msm/qdsp6v2/audio_calibration.c in the Qualcomm sound driver

Description: The trace_writeback_dirty_page implementation in include/trace/events/writeback.h in the Linux kernel before 4.4 improperly interacts with mm/migrate.c, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact by triggering a certain page move.

Description: The wasm_dis function in libr/asm/arch/wasm/wasm.c in radare2 2.0.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (stack-based buffer over-read and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted WASM file that triggers an incorrect r_hex_bin2str call.
Operation: a crafted WASM file
Consequence: a denial of service (stack-based buffer over-read and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: bitlbee-libpurple before 3.5.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a file transfer request for a contact that is not in the contact list. Description: The ParseDsdiffHeaderConfig function of the cli/dsdiff.c file of WavPack 5.1.0 allows a remote attacker to cause a denial-of-service (heap-based buffer over-read) or possibly overwrite the heap via a maliciously crafted DSDIFF file.
Location: The ParseDsdiffHeaderConfig function of the cli/dsdiff.c file
Operation: a maliciously crafted DSDIFF file

Operation: specially crafted ASF file that has to provided as input

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in ZeroClipboard.swf and ZeroClipboard10.swf in ZeroClipboard before 1.0.8, as used in em-shorty, RepRapCalculator, Fulcrum, Django, aCMS, and other products, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the id parameter. Operation: a crafted recvmsg or recvfrom system call
Consequence: obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory

Description: Array index error in the tcm_vhost_make_tpg function in drivers/vhost/scsi.c in the Linux kernel before 4.0 might allow guest OS users to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted VHOST_SCSI_SET_ENDPOINT ioctl call. NOTE: the affected function was renamed to vhost_scsi_make_tpg before the vulnerability was announced.
Operation: a crafted VHOST_SCSI_SET_ENDPOINT ioctl call
Consequence: a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: bubblewrap.c in Bubblewrap before 0.3.3 misuses temporary directories in /tmp as a mount point. In some particular configurations (related to XDG_RUNTIME_DIR), a local attacker may abuse this flaw to prevent other users from executing bubblewrap or potentially execute code.
Cause1: misuses temporary directories in /tmp as a mount point
Consequence: prevent other users from executing bubblewrap or potentially execute code

Description: Pillow before 3.3.2 allows context-dependent attackers to obtain sensitive information by using the "crafted image file" approach, related to an "Integer Overflow" issue affecting the Image.core.map_buffer in map.c component.
Operation: using the "crafted image file" approach
Consequence: obtain sensitive information

Description: Espruino before 1.99 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) with a user crafted input file via a Buffer Overflow during syntax parsing of "VOID" tokens in jsparse.c.
Consequence: a denial of service (application crash) with a user crafted input file

Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the supply_lm_input_write function in drivers/thermal/supply_lm_core.c in the MSM Thermal driver for the Linux kernel 3.x, as used in Qualcomm Innovation Center (QuIC) Android contributions for MSM devices and other products, allows attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted application that sends a large amount of data through the debugfs interface.
Location: the supply_lm_input_write function in drivers/thermal/supply_lm_core.c in the MSM Thermal driver
Version: the Linux kernel 3.x, as used in Qualcomm Innovation Center (QuIC) Android contributions for MSM devices and other products
Operation: a crafted application that sends a large amount of data through the debugfs interface
Consequence: a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: The HTMLtagproc1 function in file.c in w3m before 0.5.3+git20161009 does not properly initialize values, which allows remote attackers to crash the application via a crafted html file, related to <dd> tags.
Operation: a crafted html file
Consequence: crash the application

Description: Open redirect vulnerability in node-util/www/html/restorer.php in Red Hat OpenShift Origin before 1.0.5-3 allows remote attackers to redirect users to arbitrary web sites and conduct phishing attacks via a URL in the PATH_INFO.
Operation: a URL in the PATH_INFO
Consequence: redirect users to arbitrary web sites and conduct phishing attacks

Description: dayrui FineCms 5.2.0 before 2017.11.16 has Cross Site Scripting (XSS) in core/M_Controller.php via the DR_URI field.
Operation: the DR_URI field

Description: A security flaw was discovered in the nl80211_set_rekey_data() function in net/wireless/nl80211.c in the Linux kernel through 4.13.3. This function does not check whether the required attributes are present in a Netlink request. This request can be issued by a user with the CAP_NET_ADMIN capability and may result in a NULL pointer dereference and system crash.
Cause1: does not check whether the required attributes are present in a Netlink request
Consequence: a NULL pointer dereference and system crash

Description: Multiple integer overflows in X.org libXtst before 1.2.3 allow remote X servers to trigger out-of-bounds memory access operations by leveraging the lack of range checks.
Operation: leveraging the lack of range checks
Consequence: out-of-bounds memory access operations

Description: Wee Enhanced Environment for Chat (aka WeeChat) 0.3.4 and earlier does not properly verify that the server hostname matches the domain name of the subject of an X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof an SSL chat server via an arbitrary certificate, related to incorrect use of the GnuTLS API.
Cause1: does not properly verify that the server hostname matches the domain name of the subject of an X.509 certificate
Operation: an arbitrary certificate
Consequence: spoof an SSL chat server

Description: An integer overflow flaw was found in libtiff that exists in the tif_getimage.c file. This flaw allows an attacker to inject and execute arbitrary code when a user opens a crafted TIFF file. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.
Location: libtiff that exists in the tif_getimage.c file
Consequence: inject and execute arbitrary code

Description: epan/dissectors/packet-wap.c in Wireshark 2.x before 2.0.5 omits an overflow check in the tvb_get_guintvar function, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via a crafted packet, related to the MMSE, WAP, WBXML, and WSP dissectors.
Cause1: omits an overflow check in the tvb_get_guintvar function
Operation: a crafted packet
Consequence: a denial of service (infinite loop)

Description: In libsndfile before 1.0.28, an error in the "flac_buffer_copy()" function (flac.c) can be exploited to cause a segmentation violation (with write memory access) via a specially crafted FLAC file during a resample attempt, a similar issue to CVE-2017-7585.
Operation: a specially crafted FLAC file during a resample attempt
Consequence: a segmentation violation (with write memory access)

Description: In all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel, while processing preferred network offload scan results integer overflow may lead to buffer overflow when large frame length is received from FW.
Version: all android releases (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) from CAF using the linux kernel
Consequence: buffer overflow

Description: Node-Red is a low-code programming for event-driven applications built using nodejs. Node-RED 1.2.7 and earlier has a vulnerability which allows arbitrary path traversal via the Projects API. If the Projects feature is enabled, a user with `projects.read` permission is able to access any file via the Projects API. The issue has been patched in Node-RED 1.2.8. The vulnerability applies only to the Projects feature which is not enabled by default in Node-RED. The primary workaround is not give untrusted users read access to the Node-RED editor.
Operation: the Projects API
Consequence: access any file

Description: net/packet/af_packet.c in the Linux kernel before 4.13.6 allows local users to gain privileges via crafted system calls that trigger mishandling of packet_fanout data structures, because of a race condition (involving fanout_add and packet_do_bind) that leads to a use-after-free, a different vulnerability than CVE-2017-6346.
Cause1: a race condition (involving fanout_add and packet_do_bind)
Operation: crafted system calls
Consequence: a use-after-free

Description: LimeSurvey before 4.1.12+200324 has stored XSS in application/views/admin/surveysgroups/surveySettings.php and application/models/SurveysGroups.php (aka survey groups).

The swiotlb_print_info function in lib/swiotlb.c in the Linux kernel through 4.14.14 allows local users to obtain sensitive address information by reading dmesg data from a "software IO TLB" printk call.
Operation: reading dmesg data from a "software IO TLB" printk call
Consequence: obtain sensitive address information

Description: An issue was discovered in uriparser before 0.9.0. UriCommon.c allows attempted operations on NULL input via a uriResetUri* function.
Operation: a uriResetUri* function
Consequence: attempted operations on NULL input

Description: GraphQL Playground (graphql-playground-html NPM package) before version 1.6.22 have a severe XSS Reflection attack vulnerability. All unsanitized user input passed into renderPlaygroundPage() method could trigger this vulnerability. This has been patched in graphql-playground-html version 1.6.22. Note that some of the associated dependent middleware packages are also affected including but not limited to graphql-playground-middleware-express before version 1.7.16, graphql-playground-middleware-koa before version 1.6.15, graphql-playground-middleware-lambda before version 1.7.17, and graphql-playground-middleware-hapi before 1.6.13.
Cause1: a severe XSS Reflection attack vulnerability
Version: GraphQL Playground (graphql-playground-html NPM package) before version 1.6.22
Operation: All unsanitized user input passed into renderPlaygroundPage() method

Description: SonarSource SonarQube before 7.8 has XSS in project links on account/projects.

A SQL injection vulnerability exists in the Impress GiveWP Give plugin through 2.5.0 for WordPress. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability would allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary SQL commands on the affected system via includes/payments/class-payments-query.php.
Version: the Impress GiveWP Give plugin through 2.5.0 for WordPress
Consequence: execute arbitrary SQL commands on the affected system

Description: libavcodec in FFmpeg 4.0 may trigger a NULL pointer dereference if the studio profile is incorrectly detected while converting a crafted AVI file to MPEG4, leading to a denial of service, related to idctdsp.c and mpegvideo.c.
Consequence: a denial of service

Description: Multiple buffer overflows in the cifs subsystem in the Linux kernel before 2.6.29.4 allow remote CIFS servers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) and possibly have unspecified other impact via (1) a malformed Unicode string, related to Unicode string area alignment in fs/cifs/sess.c; or (2) long Unicode characters, related to fs/cifs/cifssmb.c and the cifs_readdir function in fs/cifs/readdir.c.
Operation: (1) a malformed Unicode string
Consequence: a denial of service (memory corruption) and possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: In the Linux kernel 4.14.x, 4.15.x, 4.16.x, 4.17.x, and 4.18.x before 4.18.13, faulty computation of numeric bounds in the BPF verifier permits out-of-bounds memory accesses because adjust_scalar_min_max_vals in kernel/bpf/verifier.c mishandles 32-bit right shifts.
Cause1: adjust_scalar_min_max_vals in kernel/bpf/verifier.c mishandles 32-bit right shifts
Cause2: faulty computation of numeric bounds in the BPF verifier
Consequence: out-of-bounds memory accesses

Description: The sctp_init function in net/sctp/protocol.c in the Linux kernel before 4.2.3 has an incorrect sequence of protocol-initialization steps, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (panic or memory corruption) by creating SCTP sockets before all of the steps have finished.
Cause1: has an incorrect sequence of protocol-initialization steps
Operation: creating SCTP sockets before all of the steps have finished
Consequence: a denial of service (panic or memory corruption)

Description: In FusionPBX up to 4.5.7, the file app\destinations\destination_imports.php uses an unsanitized "query_string" variable coming from the URL, which is reflected on 2 occasions in HTML, leading to XSS.
Cause1: uses an unsanitized "query_string" variable coming from the URL
Consequence: XSS

Description: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Dolibarr ERP/CRM 3.8.3 and earlier allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the (1) external calendar url or (2) the bank name field in the "import external calendar" page.
Operation: the (1) external calendar url or (2) the bank name field in the "import external calendar" page
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: xorg-x11-server before 1.19.5 was missing length validation in XFree86 DRI extension allowing malicious X client to cause X server to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code.
Consequence: X server to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code

Description: tif_predict.h and tif_predict.c in libtiff 4.0.6 have assertions that can lead to assertion failures in debug mode, or buffer overflows in release mode, when dealing with unusual tile size like YCbCr with subsampling. Reported as MSVR 35105, aka "Predictor heap-buffer-overflow."
Consequence: assertion failures in debug mode, or buffer overflows in release mode

Description: Keymaker is a Mastodon Community Finder based Matrix Community serverlist page Server. In Keymaker before version 0.2.0, the assets endpoint did not check for the extension. The rust `join` method without checking user input might have made it abe to do a Path Traversal attack causing to read more files than allowed. This is fixed in version 0.2.0.
Cause1: the assets endpoint did not check for the extension
Cause2: The rust `join` method without checking user input
Consequence: read more files than allowed

Description: epan/dissectors/packet-pktap.c in the Ethernet dissector in Wireshark 2.x before 2.0.4 mishandles the packet-header data type, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet.
Operation: a crafted packet
Consequence: a denial of service (application crash)

Description: drivers/media/platform/msm/camera_v2/sensor/csid/msm_csid.c in the Qualcomm camera driver in Android before 2016-10-05 on Nexus 5, Nexus 5X, Nexus 6, Nexus 6P, and Android One devices allows attackers to gain privileges via a crafted application, aka Android internal bug 29513227 and Qualcomm internal bug CR 1040857.
Version: Android before 2016-10-05 on Nexus 5, Nexus 5X, Nexus 6, Nexus 6P, and Android One devices
Operation: a crafted application
Consequence: gain privileges

Description: Directory traversal vulnerability in device-linux.c in the router advertisement daemon (radvd) before 1.8.2 allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files, and remote attackers to overwrite certain files, via a .. (dot dot) in an interface name. NOTE: this can be leveraged with a symlink to overwrite arbitrary files.
Operation: a .. (dot dot) in an interface name
Consequence: overwrite arbitrary files, and remote attackers to overwrite certain files

Description: wp-includes/feed.php in WordPress before 4.9.1 does not properly restrict enclosures in RSS and Atom fields, which might allow attackers to conduct XSS attacks via a crafted URL.
Cause1: does not properly restrict enclosures in RSS and Atom fields
Operation: a crafted URL
Consequence: conduct XSS attacks

Description: The WP Statistics plugin through 12.6.5 for Wordpress has stored XSS in includes/class-wp-statistics-pages.php. This is related to an account with the Editor role creating a post with a title that contains JavaScript, to attack an admin user.
Version: The WP Statistics plugin through 12.6.5 for Wordpress
Attacker: an account with the Editor role
Operation: creating a post with a title that contains JavaScript
Consequence: attack an admin user

Description: The get_siz function in libavcodec/jpeg2000dec.c in FFmpeg before 2.1 does not prevent attempts to use non-zero image offsets, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds array access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JPEG2000 data.
Cause1: does not prevent attempts to use non-zero image offsets
Operation: crafted JPEG2000 data
Consequence: a denial of service (out-of-bounds array access) or possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: The cr_input_new_from_uri function in cr-input.c in libcroco 0.6.11 and 0.6.12 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read) via a crafted CSS file.
Operation: a crafted CSS file
Consequence: a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read)

Description: The Cisco HDLC parser in tcpdump before 4.9.2 has a buffer over-read in print-chdlc.c:chdlc_print().

epan/dissectors/packet-umts_fp.c in the UMTS FP dissector in Wireshark 2.x before 2.0.6 does not ensure that memory is allocated for certain data structures, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid write access and application crash) via a crafted packet.

Location: epan/dissectors/packet-umts_fp.c in the UMTS FP dissector
Operation: a crafted packet
Consequence: a denial of service (invalid write access and application crash)

Description: ad-ldap-connector's admin panel before version 5.0.13 does not provide csrf protection, which when exploited may result in remote code execution or confidential data loss. CSRF exploits may occur if the user visits a malicious page containing CSRF payload on the same machine that has access to the ad-ldap-connector admin console via a browser. You may be affected if you use the admin console included with ad-ldap-connector versions <=5.0.12. If you do not have ad-ldap-connector admin console enabled or do not visit any other public URL while on the machine it is installed on, you are not affected. The issue is fixed in version 5.0.13.
Consequence: remote code execution or confidential data loss

Description: The key_replace_session_keyring function in security/keys/process_keys.c in the Linux kernel before 2.6.39.1 does not initialize a certain structure member, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and OOPS) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a KEYCTL_SESSION_TO_PARENT argument to the keyctl function, a different vulnerability than CVE-2010-2960.
Cause1: does not initialize a certain structure member
Operation: a KEYCTL_SESSION_TO_PARENT argument to the keyctl function
Consequence: a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and OOPS) or possibly have unspecified other impact

Description: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Dolibarr 3.1.0 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via (1) the username parameter in a setup action to admin/company.php, or the PATH_INFO to (2) admin/security_other.php, (3) admin/events.php, or (4) admin/user.php.
Operation: (1) the username parameter in a setup action to admin/company.php, or the PATH_INFO to (2) admin/security_other.php, (3) admin/events.php, or (4) admin/user.php
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: The ASF Demuxer (modules/demux/asf/asf.c) in VideoLAN VLC media player 2.0.5 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted ASF movie that triggers an out-of-bounds read.
Version: VideoLAN VLC media player 2.0.5 and earlier
Operation: a crafted ASF movie
Consequence: a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code

Description: arch/powerpc/kvm/book3s_hv_rmhandlers.S in the Linux kernel through 4.7 on PowerPC platforms, when CONFIG_KVM_BOOK3S_64_HV is enabled, allows guest OS users to cause a denial of service (host OS infinite loop) by making a H_CEDE hypercall during the existence of a suspended transaction.

Operation: making a H_CEDE hypercall during the existence of a suspended transaction
Consequence: a denial of service (host OS infinite loop)

Description: The Subscription Manager package (aka subscription-manager) before 1.17.7-1 for Candlepin uses weak permissions (755) for subscription-manager cache directories, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information by reading files in the directories.
Cause1: uses weak permissions (755) for subscription-manager cache directories
Version: The Subscription Manager package (aka subscription-manager) before 1.17.7-1 for Candlepin
Operation: reading files in the directories

Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Roundcube Webmail 0.8.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the signature in an email.
Operation: the signature in an email
Consequence: inject arbitrary web script or HTML

Description: The get_next_block function in archival/libarchive/decompress_bunzip2.c in BusyBox 1.27.2 has an Integer Overflow that may lead to a write access violation.

Description: Versions of Apache CXF Fediz prior to 1.4.4 do not fully disable Document Type Declarations (DTDs) when either parsing the Identity Provider response in the application plugins, or in the Identity Provider itself when parsing certain XML-based parameters.
Cause1: do not fully disable Document Type Declarations (DTDs)
Version: Versions of Apache CXF Fediz prior to 1.4.4

Description: app/webroot/js/misp.js in MISP 2.4.91 has a DOM based XSS with cortex type attributes.
Cause1: a DOM based XSS with cortex type attributes

Description: The sctp_assoc_update function in net/sctp/associola.c in the Linux kernel through 3.15.8, when SCTP authentication is enabled, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and OOPS) by starting to establish an association between two endpoints immediately after an exchange of INIT and INIT ACK chunks to establish an earlier association between these endpoints in the opposite direction.
Operation: starting to establish an association between two endpoints immediately after an exchange of INIT and INIT ACK chunks to establish an earlier association between these endpoints in the opposite direction
Consequence: a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and OOPS)

Description: camel/providers/imapx/camel-imapx-server.c in the IMAPx component in GNOME evolution-data-server before 3.21.2 proceeds with cleartext data containing a password if the client wishes to use STARTTLS but the server will not use STARTTLS, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain sensitive information by sniffing the network. The server code was intended to report an error and not proceed, but the code was written incorrectly.
Cause1: proceeds with cleartext data containing a password if the client wishes to use STARTTLS but the server will not use STARTTLS
Operation: sniffing the network
Consequence: obtain sensitive information

Description: An integer overflow in the PngImg::InitStorage_() function of png-img before 3.1.0 leads to an under-allocation of heap memory and subsequently an exploitable heap-based buffer overflow when loading a crafted PNG file.
Consequence: an under-allocation of heap memory and subsequently an exploitable heap-based buffer overflow

Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the ttusbdecfe_dvbs_diseqc_send_master_cmd function in drivers/media/usb/ttusb-dec/ttusbdecfe.c in the Linux kernel before 3.17.4 allows local users to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly gain privileges via a large message length in an ioctl call.
Operation: a large message length in an ioctl call
Consequence: a denial of service (system crash) or possibly gain privileges

Description: The yr_arena_write_data function in YARA 3.6.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer over-read and application crash) or obtain sensitive information from process memory via a crafted file that is mishandled in the yr_re_fast_exec function in libyara/re.c and the _yr_scan_match_callback function in libyara/scan.c.
Operation: a crafted file that is mishandled
Consequence: a denial of service (buffer over-read and application crash) or obtain sensitive information from process memory

Description: While parsing an IPAddressFamily extension in an X.509 certificate, it is possible to do a one-byte overread. This would result in an incorrect text display of the certificate. This bug has been present since 2006 and is present in all versions of OpenSSL before 1.0.2m and 1.1.0g.
Version: all versions of OpenSSL before 1.0.2m and 1.1.0g
Consequence: an incorrect text display of the certificate

Description: libcontainer/user/user.go in runC before 0.1.0, as used in Docker before 1.11.2, improperly treats a numeric UID as a potential username, which allows local users to gain privileges via a numeric username in the password file in a container.
Cause1: improperly treats a numeric UID as a potential username
Operation: a numeric username in the password file in a container
Consequence: gain privileges

Description: The TS_OBJ_print_bio function in crypto/ts/ts_lib.c in the X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Time-Stamp Protocol (TSP) implementation in OpenSSL through 1.0.2h allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and application crash) via a crafted time-stamp file that is mishandled by the "openssl ts" command.
Location: The TS_OBJ_print_bio function in crypto/ts/ts_lib.c in the X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Time-Stamp Protocol (TSP) implementation
Operation: a crafted time-stamp file that is mishandled by the "openssl ts" command
Consequence: a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and application crash)

Operation: a crafted ELF file
Consequence: a denial of service (heap-based out-of-bounds read and application crash)

Description: Valve's Game Networking Sockets prior to version v1.2.0 improperly handles long unreliable segments in function SNP_ReceiveUnreliableSegment() when configured to support plain-text messages, leading to a Heap-Based Buffer Overflow and resulting in a memory corruption and possibly even a remote code execution.

Consequence: a Heap-Based Buffer Overflow and resulting in a memory corruption and possibly even a remote code execution

Description: Integer overflow in the agp_generic_insert_memory function in drivers/char/agp/generic.c in the Linux kernel before 2.6.38.5 allows local users to gain privileges or cause a denial of service (system crash) via a crafted AGPIOC_BIND agp_ioctl ioctl call.

Description: xorg-x11-server before 1.19.5 was missing length validation in XINERAMA extension allowing malicious X client to cause X server to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Description: An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.2.3. Out of bounds access exists in the functions ath6kl_wmi_pstream_timeout_event_rx and ath6kl_wmi_cac_event_rx in the file drivers/net/wireless/ath/ath6kl/wmi.c.
Location: the functions ath6kl_wmi_pstream_timeout_event_rx and ath6kl_wmi_cac_event_rx in the file drivers/net/wireless/ath/ath6kl/wmi.c

Description: The r_read_* functions in libr/include/r_endian.h in radare2 1.2.1 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via a crafted binary file, as demonstrated by the r_read_le32 function.

Consequence: a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash)

Description: The error-message functionality in Moodle 1.9.x before 1.9.13, 2.0.x before 2.0.4, and 2.1.x before 2.1.1 does not ensure that a continuation link refers to an http or https URL for the local Moodle instance, which might allow attackers to trick users into visiting arbitrary web sites via unspecified vectors.

Description: The installation process in LibreNMS before 2017-08-18 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files, related to html/install.php.

Description: The cma_req_handler function in drivers/infiniband/core/cma.c in the Linux kernel 3.14.x through 3.14.1 attempts to resolve an RDMA over Converged Ethernet (aka RoCE) address that is properly resolved within a different module, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (incorrect pointer dereference and system crash) via crafted network traffic.

Operation: a crafted (1) width or (2) height dimension that is not a multiple of sixteen in id RoQ video data

Description: Wire is an open-source collaboration platform. In Wire for iOS (iPhone and iPad) before version 3.75 there is a vulnerability where the video capture isn't stopped in a scenario where a user first has their camera enabled and then disables it. It's a privacy issue because video is streamed to the call when the user believes it is disabled. It impacts all users in video calls. This is fixed in version 3.75.

Consequence: the video capture isn't stopped in a scenario

Cause1: a SQL INSERT statement with raw header data from an HTTP request (e.g., Referer and User-Agent)
